entry.title: Any farmer can earn millions by beekeeping
entry.content:
Bees are reared to obtain honey, pollen, etc.It is an agriculture based industry.  Bees convert the juice of flowers into honey and store them in their hives.  The tradition of collecting honey from the forests has been disappearing for a long time.Due to the increasing demand of honey and its products in the market, beekeeping is now established as a profitable and lucrative enterprise.Honey and beeswax are economically important as a beekeeping product.


Major species

There are four major species of bees in the Indian subcontinent.These are Apis mellifera, Apis indica, Apis dorsata and Apis florea.For this business, Apis mellifera flies are more honey producing and calm in nature.They can be easily reared in compartments.The queen fly of this species also has more egg laying capacity.

Caution

The land around where the bees are reared should be clean.Big ants, waxy insects, lizards, rats, chameleons, and bears are enemies of bees, they should have complete protection.Apart from this, the bees get goat disease, which causes embryos to rot and cripples bees.Sarfaraz explains, "The drug is available in the market to protect the bees from the disease."

Loan from government

In the last few years, the trend towards beekeeping has increased.The government has provided loan facility from nationalized banks for this industry.Loans ranging from two to five lakh rupees are available for this business.This industry falls under the Small Scale Industries category.

Essential goods

It is necessary to arrange a wooden box, boxframe, reticle cover to cover the mouth, gloves, knife, honey, removing machine, honey collecting drum for bee keeping.

Pesticide use dangerous

Bees are friends of farmers, they help in pollination of crops.But most of the farmers use pesticide chemicals to protect their crops, which causes bees to face pollination.Pesticides contain imidaclopride chemical, which causes the most damage to bees.This has also become evident in an experiment conducted in the US in 2010.

Sweet honey

After milk, all the ingredients are found in honey, which should be in a balanced diet.Honey increases eyesight, reduces thirst, dissolves phlegm, and reduces toxicity in the body.It controls vata and phlegm and keeps blood and bile normal.Apart from honey, beekeepers also get wax as a by-product for income, which makes bees make their hive.

Training

A number of certificate, diploma or degree courses can be done related to smoking.Courses ranging from one week to nine months are available for training.A less educated person, who is interested in this business, can also start his own business by getting training.Beekeeping training is imparted at many centers across the country, including the Beekeeping Training Center in Dehradun, Jyoti Gramodyog Sansthan of Saharanpur.

How honey is prepared

Five to seven thousand bees live in a box.  It has a queen bee and some drones (male bees) and worker bees.  At the time of flowering, boxes are usually kept in fields and orchards from January-February to April-May.  From a range of three km, bees bring juice from flowers and fill it in the hive of boxes.Worker bees dry the water by handling the juice brought from their wings and honey is ready.Honey is extracted from the honeycomb and packed in the processing unit.Before buying a cow, buffalo, you can also identify whether it is milch or not.Our farmer brothers or even those people who do animal husbandry or buy cows to produce milk in their homes, but they are unable to know whether it is milch or not.Yes, cattle herders buy animals at an expensive price, but later the milk production has to be reduced, the animal has to face many problems like pre-existing diseases.  It also causes economic loss to cattlemen.To avoid this problem, some things have to be kept in mind.Cattlemen should buy only after taking into consideration the anatomy of the animal, breast system, age, health, reproduction and pedigree.

View milk production

The price of a milch animal in the market is determined according to the milk of the animal, so it should be milked for two-three days before buying it.At milking, the edge of milk should fall straight and after milking, the udder should shrink.

The body of the animal also tells

The body of a good milch animal is thin from the front and wide from the back.  His nostrils are open and the jaws are strong.His eyes are bulging, the tail is long and the skin is smooth and thin.  The chest part develops and the back widens.The thigh of a milch animal is thin and the neck is thin.Its four udder are equally long, thick and equally spaced.

Genealogy

Detection of the pedigree of animals can be a true test of their breed and milk production capacity.There is no trend in our country to keep records of the lineage of animals, but by purchasing cattle from dairy farms, its pedigree can be known.

Fertility

The right milch cow or buffalo is the one who gives a child every year.  Therefore, it is important to know the breeding record of the animal while purchasing it.Due to poor fertility record, many problems like animal weakness, miscarriage, not having a healthy baby, problems in childbirth can come up.

Ages

It is very beneficial to buy milk animals with two to three teeth for doing milk business.The age of animals is known by looking at the texture and number of their teeth.The two-year-old animal has eight permanent and eight temporary teeth in the front, upside-down.At the age of five, there are 16 permanent and 16 temporary teeth mixed up and down.  Animals above six years of age have 32 permanent and 20 temporary teeth.

link.title: Any farmer can earn millions by beekeeping

entry.title: Fish farming will benefit millions with less effort and less cost
entry.content:
Fish are aquatic organisms dependent on aquatic environment and have a very important role in keeping the aquatic environment balanced.This statement has enough force in itself, if the water does not have fish, then surely the water biological condition of that water is not normal.Fish has been considered as a life indicator by scientists.Whether it is a fast or slow flowing river in different waters, whether natural lakes, ponds or man-made large or medium sized reservoirs, if a subtle study of the environment of all is done, then it is concluded that both water and fish are one  Are closely related to the other.  Fish has special utility in keeping the environment balanced.


This is how to prepare fish farming

It is advisable to prepare the pond for fish before the rainy season.Fisheries can be done in all types of small and big seasonal and seasonal ponds.In addition, such ponds in which other aquatic botanical crops like Singhada, Kamalagatta, Murar (Dhse) etc. are taken, they are also suitable for fisheries.The fertilizer, water and fertility of the pond are increased by the manure, fertilizer, other food items, etc., which are added to the pond for fisheries, as a result the crop yield also increases.The wastes of these vegetable crops that rot in the pond water make the water and soil more fertile, producing plankton (the plankton), the best natural diet for fish.  In this way, both become complementary to each other and are helpful in increasing yields.Even in paddy fields where sufficient water is filled from June July to October November, additional income can be obtained by rearing fish.Paddy fields require a different type of preparation for fish farming.

Farmers plow the fields to get good yield from their fields, repair the rams of the fields as necessary, remove weeds, prepare the land by giving them manure and fertilizer etc. and sow the seeds when the time comes.After germination, the seedlings take good care of it and take care of them, using nitrogen, spur and potash manure as required.Uses medicines etc. to prevent plant diseases at the appropriate time.  Similarly, to get good yields of fish, it is necessary to do these activities in fish farming also.

Prepare pond for fish farming

There is no possibility of being a carnivorous and unseasonable petty species in seasonal ponds, however in perennial ponds these fish may occur.  Therefore, in such ponds, when the lake has the lowest water level in the month of June, by running a trap again and again, the harmful fish and insects should be removed.If cattle etc. do not drink water in the pond, then Mahua cake should be used at the rate of 2000 to 2500 kg per hectare per meter to kill such fish in it.The creatures living in water die by using Mahua cake.  And the fish also come up first after dying due to being affected.

If they are taken out at this time, they can be used for eating and selling.It is important to keep in mind that the pond should not be used for disposal for 2 to 3 weeks after its use.Lime is added at the rate of 250 to 300 kg per hectare 3 weeks after mahua cake and before filling water in seasonal ponds in which water-dwelling insects die.Lime water pH  Controls increase alkalinity and keep water clean.After one week of lime, dung manure should be applied in the pond at the value of 10,000 kg per hectare per year.  The amount of cow dung can be reduced in the ponds where the water of the fields or the water of the sapling comes in the rain, because such quantity of fertilizer is available in this type of water.Proper arrangement should also be made to put lattice in the inward and outward gates of the pond.

Before putting fish seed in the pond, it should be checked that there is plenty of natural fish (plankton) available in that pond.In order to have a good amount of plankton in the pond, it is necessary that superphosphate along with cow dung manure and 300 kg of urea should be added per hectare per year.Therefore, 10-year installments of the prescribed quantity (10000 kg cow dung, 300 kg superphosphate and 180 kg urea) should be added equally for the year.In this way, 1000 kg of cow dung manure, 30 kg super phosphate and 18 kg urea are used in the pond and a lot of plankton is produced.

Take advantage of government schemes also

A person who has his own private pond, his land or leased pond can get government facilities provided for fisheries in any district in Uttar Pradesh, he will have to go to the district office just by taking the measles letter of the respective land.is.If the pond is taken on lease, contact the district office with the lease release certificate.The project is prepared by surveying the land (pond) by the Department of Fisheries Officer, Regional Fisheries.

Fish seed harvesting

Generally, storage should be done in the pond at the rate of 10000 fry or 5000 fingerlings per hectare.It has been realized that this small amount of accumulation does not make full use of the food available in the water and more accumulation does not provide enough food for all the fish.  For proper use of the food available in the pond, the katla takes food available on the surface, rohu in the middle and the mrigal fish at the bottom of the pond.  In this way, the fish seed harvesting of these three species properly utilizes the food available at the water level of the pond and maximum yield can be obtained from it.

In addition to the major native fishes (katla, rohu, mrigal), which are rearing, some exotic species of fish (grass carp, silver carp common carp) have also started accumulating in abundance nowadays.Therefore, the seeds of fishes of native and exotic species can be stored under mixed fisheries.These fish of foreign species do not compete with any of the major native fishes.Silver carp fish do not accept spears from the upper surface of the water like Katla, from the pillar like grass carp rohu and from the bottom of the pond like Kaman carp mrigal.Therefore, when all the six species of fish seed are harvested, katla, silvercorp, rohu, grasscorp, mrigal and common carp should be harvested in the ratio of 20: 20: 15: 15: 15: 15.  Normally, fish seed is packed in polythene packet by filling water and putting oxygen oxygen. The packet should be kept in pond water for a while before releasing fish seed in the pond.Thereafter, some water in the pond should be prepared inside the packet to prepare the atmosphere for uniformity (eclimatized) and then the packet's lees should be slowly released into the pond water.This helps in increasing the survival of fish seed.

Fish diet related information

If the fish food in the pond is low or the flood of the fish is low, then the rice husk (Kanaki mixed rice polis) and mustard or peanut cake should be given at a value of about 1800 to 2700 kg per hectare per year.

It should be applied at a certain time every day so that the fish binds the time of eating it and the food is not wasted.It is advisable to fill the food stuff and tie several places in the pond with the help of poles and make a fine hole about it.It is also important to keep in mind that most of the sack is immersed in water and some part of water  Stay up

Under normal circumstances, where fisheries are produced in the old ways, production of 500-600 kg per hectare per annum is achieved, whereas fisheries can be produced 3000 to 5000 kg / ha / year by modern scientific method.  In Andhra Pradesh, fisheries are being produced by this method up to 7000 kg / ha / year.

Fish farmers should monitor the growth of accumulated fish every month by running a net, which will make it easier to determine the amount of supplementary food to be fed to the fish and the growth rate of the accumulated fish will be known.If any disease is seen, treatment should be done immediately.

link.title: Fish farming will benefit millions with less effort and less cost

entry.title: If you want to do your own employment, then pig rearing will give you millions in short time
entry.content:
It is very important to arrange food for the growing population.Cereals and meat, milk, fish, eggs, etc.are used as food.In Chhotanagpur, where it is possible to bring the same crop from the field due to lack of irrigation, farmers are sitting without employment for more days of the year.This waste sitting is one of the main reasons of poverty, we can use this time properly through animal husbandry.Therefore, animal husbandry can be successful in removing poverty.Tribal people produce chicken, pig, cow, buffalo and goat, but due to lack of improved breed and improved breeding methods, they do not get full benefit.  Piggery, which is a major part of the life of the tribals, can benefit more by doing it in the form of employment.


Profitable business

Increasing production of food grains is not only necessary for the growing population of our country.It is the responsibility of the people engaged in animal husbandry to increase the production of some nutritious foods like meat, milk, eggs, fish etc., so that the burden on the production of grains can be reduced.The place of the pig comes first in increasing the production of meat in a short time.  From this point of view, the business of pig farming is highly profitable.In making one kilogram of meat, where cattle, cows, etc.have to give 10-20 kg of food, the pig needs 4-5 kg of food.  A female pig can give a child every 6 months and 10-12 babies can be taken if she is well cared for.After two months, they stop drinking mother's milk and after getting good food, they become 50-60 kg in 6 months.This quality can only be adopted by the best breed foreign pigs.Such best-of-breed pigs are being reared and distributed in abundance in our country.Their weight goes up to 150-200 kg in two years.  By thinking from the point of view of diet, we get very necessary and excessive amount of protein through pork.It has the ability to use poor quality food items like rotten fruits, grains, kitchen scavengers, farm products, meat, waste from factories, etc. than other animals.The food problem of our country can be solved in this way by the pig rearing business.Good big pigs can give about 1 ton of manure a year.  Its hair is used to make brushes.We can also save in foreign currency with these benefits.

Arrangement of accommodation for pigs

The houses should be constructed in a modern manner so that they are clean and well ventilated.There should be separate rooms for pig of different ages.These are 

Maternity pig housing

This room should normally be 10 feet long and 8 feet wide and there should be an open space of double the area adjoining this room.The children usually stay with the mother for two months.They live on mother's milk for about 4 weeks.After this they start eating some food.So after one month they should be kept in mind that it was made for children.So that they can grow fast.It should be kept in mind that the Suri cannot eat the food of the child.In this way, the corner of the room is made easily by enclosing wire rods.  The system of heat is necessary for children during winter.In the maternity Suri's house, an iron or lumbar 3-inch to 4-inch thick roof of the wall is made 9 inches apart from the wall around the wall, which is called guard rail.Small pig survivors often die after being buried by their mother's body, for which this guard rail is necessary.

Accommodation for Gabin Suri

These houses should keep the Suri who has eaten Pal.Living among other pigs is likely to cause injury to gabrious pigs due to fighting with each other or due to other reasons, which may damage their womb.3-4 suari can be easily kept in each room.Each gabriess must give at least 10-12 square feet of space for sitting or sleeping.In the living room itself, there should be a sound for his food to drink and there should be an open space for him to move from that room.

Accommodation for the horny boar

Suri that is not eaten or cut, the suari should be kept in such a house.  Up to 3-4 suras can be kept in each room.  Like the house of Gabin, it should also have a place to eat and drink and to roam.At least 10-12 square feet of space should be given for each suari to sleep or sit.

Accommodation for male pig

The male pig which is used for breeding should be kept in a separate room from the pig.Only one male pig should be kept in each room.More than one living together start fighting among themselves and try to eat the food of others 10 feet for male pigs.  X 8 feet space should be given in the living room.There should be open space in the living room to eat food, drink and open space to move around.Such a sound should measure 6 X4 X3 X4 '.  It would be beneficial to have such a sound in all the above types of houses.

Housing for growing children

After two months, ordinary children are separated from their mother and are separated.Male and female children are separated at 4 months of age.It is good to keep children of one age together.  By doing this, the child gets the same food and grows equally.There should be an average 3X4 'space for each child and they should be carefully locked in the room at night.

Diet for pigs

To get the full benefit, it is very important to pay attention to food.  It is seen that 75 percent of the entire expenditure is spent on its food.Food requirements vary on every aspect of the pig's life.Growing children and maternity pigs require a high amount of protein, so 19 percent or more of the protein is kept in their food.A mixture of corn, groundnut cake, wheat bran, fish powder, mineral salts, vitamins and salt is given in the food.  Its mixture is increased or decreased according to the need in the initial diet, the increase diet, as needed in the breeding diet.

The forests are full in Chotanagpur area.Many fruit trees such as Guler and Mahua are found in the forest.Gular fruits are nutritious ingredients.After keeping it dry it can also be fed later.  Pigs also eat well with saucer seed, mango kernels and berries.Guava and kendu also eat zoar with great fervor.Pigs can be fed well, which is used to throw the sit of maad and hadiya.Pigs dig the ground in the ghats originating from the hill and obtain tuber root.

Reproduction

Male pigs that go to forage in 8-9 months.But keeping in mind, it should be used for breeding only after one year.  Breeding should be done 3-4 times a week.The female pig is also able to conceive in about a year.

Prevention of diseases

Prevention of diseases is a very prominent subject in the animal husbandry business.By not paying proper attention to it, we cannot get proper benefit.Pre-treatment of diseases is always better than treatment after illness.In this way, a healthy body cannot claim small fat diseases.If the place of living of the pigs is clean, clean water and nutritious food is given, then the production capacity increases.At the same time, problems coming in the form of illness can be avoided.

infectious disease

A) Accidental or suspicious pig should be separated from the group.It is necessary to have a good arrangement of fodder and water.After this, measures should be stopped on the advice of veterinary medicine.

B) The person taking care of the diseased animal should wash his hands and feet with antibacterial medicine and go to the healthy animal.

C) The house where the patient is in the animal should be cleaned regularly with DDT or phenyl.

D) The contaminated germs remain in the excreta of the patient.Therefore, keeping warm or using insecticides should destroy the germs living in excreta.If an animal dies from contagious disease, its corpse should be well buried.Before burial, lime and bleaching powder should be filled on the corpse and in the fabric so that the disease cannot spread.

Some infectious diseases of pigs


Swollen fever

The main symptoms of this disease are high fever, sleepiness, diarrhea and diarrhea, difficulty in breathing, redness and yellow spots on the body.This disease can be avoided by getting vaccinated from time to time.

Chicken pox

The main symptoms of the disease are fever, sluggishness, loss of appetite, and blistering on the ears, neck and other parts of the body, the patient pigs moving slowly, and sometimes their hair growth.This disease can be avoided by getting a vaccine.

Cracking mouth

Fever, cracking and small sores in the mouth, pig lame walking are the main symptoms of this disease.Due to blisters in the mouth there is difficulty in eating and the pig dies of hunger.Applying phenyl mixed water on hoof wounds and applying neem leaf is beneficial.Even this disease does not reach the animals due to vaccination.

New yellow fever

Fever increases in this disease.The pulse goes faster.Hands and feet get cold.The animal dies suddenly.Blood also comes in urine.In this disease, there is also a vaccine for the creation of pig's throat.

Eri sepless

High fever, blisters on the skin, redness of the ears and diarrhea are the main symptoms of this disease.The patient pig is always at risk of neimania.This disease can be avoided by getting a vaccine.

Tuberculosis

The patient swells gilt in any part of the pig, which later breaks out and causes pus from it.Apart from this, the patient pig also gets fever.This pig starts having symptoms of tuberculosis.  They should be killed and buried in his corpse by sprinkling lime or bleaching powder.

Latch

The patient pig wants to be lethargic and lie down every second.He gets a slight fever and starts to lean fast.  Giving light digestible food and clean water is very important.It is very important to keep the patient pig separately and clean the urine pad immediately.

Parasitic Hail and Nutritional Diseases

Pigs are more relaxed.  Which can be treated by spraying of Gamaxine.It should also be sprayed on the cracks and walls of the pig house.In pigs, there is more disease called Khaura due to which the pig keeps rubbing itself in the walls.Therefore, to avoid this, a pillar should be wrapped and soaked with a medicine made of sulfur in the place of roaming, burying a pillar, adjacent to the pig house.So that the pig rubs itself in it and gets rid of the rams.To kill the parasitic organisms living in the stomach and intestine of the pig, one should give parasitic antidote with the advice of a veterinarian every month.Otherwise this philanthropist will prove to be a great hindrance in our profit.

When the child gives a sure-footed Suri, a deficiency of iron element is often found in the child.For this protection, in each corner of the delivery house, the basket should be kept in clean soil by mixing green cassis and the pig children can lick the iron element by flipping it.

Things to note


1. If the child is able to get milk according to their need or not from maternity pig, then feeding should be arranged separately for them.  Otherwise the children will die of hunger.
2. Iodine tincture should be applied in the navel of newborns.
3. After 2 days of birth, infants should be injected with infants.
4. Pigs must be inspected at least after two hours in 24 hours.
5. Separate arrangement of food should be made for weak pig.
6. Special attention should be paid to cleaning the house.
7. Proper arrangements should be made for every pig child or elder to eat well.
8. For a big male pig, there should be 3-4 kg of food for the day.
9. A female pig can give 14 to 16 children at a time. If proper arrangement is made, a female pig can give a baby once a year.
10. The vaccine of dry fever and hoof mouth should be applied once in a year.
11. A child becomes pregnant within 3-4 days of separation of the baby and if the pig is in a healthy condition, then it should be reared immediately for the purpose of taking the baby 2 times a year.
12. Pigs naka are on average 12, 14 baat (breast).Therefore, yellowing of each breast can be done in the same number of children.The flow of milk in the breast to the pigs is often different from the breast at the back.Hence;  The baby who drinks ahead of the breast is more healthy.  If the child who is drinking the breast of the back is becoming weak, then it should be attempted that the next thing should be held for 2-3 days while drinking milk so that it starts drinking it.

link.title: If you want to do your own employment, then pig rearing will give you millions in short time

entry.title: You can also earn millions from cow rearing
entry.content:
Animal husbandry is the branch of agricultural science under which various aspects of domestic animals such as food, shelter, health, breeding, etc.are studied.Animal husbandry is being read as an important subject in various universities of the world.Milk production is most easy and beneficial for farmers in agricultural rural business.Farmers have easy access to fodder from various crops.Therefore, the cost of milk production in India is the lowest in the world.But due to lack of proper management of dairy, farmers face many problems in it.  Domestic milch animals are usually reared by ten to fifteen animals in the country.Dairy of so many animals will be called as small scale.Buffalo care has to be reduced, but cow's usefulness is high due to milking throughout the year.Mixed rearing of cross-breed cows and buffaloes is beneficial for small dairy farms run by farmers.Raising only native cow or rearing buffalo is also beneficial.


Although the cow has great importance in the whole world, but in the context of India, it has been the backbone of India's economy since ancient times.  Whether it is a matter of milk or of bulls used in farming.In the Vedic period the number of cows used to be the standard of prosperity of a person.  Being a milch animal, it is a very useful domestic animal.Cow farming is the most widely spread business, both at the small and large scale.Cow farming business, commercial or small scale milk production helps farmers in total milk production and enhances their economic growth.There is no doubt that dairy farmers have played the most important role in economic growth from milk production in India for many years.Milk production by rearing cows has contributed to the economy of our country in a big way and has helped many poor farmers to establish their own business by rearing cows.If one has the initial capital to set up a milk production business, then the milk production business can be easily established in any area.

So choose animals

Whenever you think of doing cow rearing business, it is very important for you to know which breed of cow gives the most milk.Which breed of cow's calf grows quickly to produce milk or how much you can sell to male calves should be well known.  Cows should be bought according to the climate of your city so that they can destroy the climate of your city, so it is better that you buy cows from your city.It is also important for you to know which breed of milk there is more local demand.Decide whether cow rearing or buffalo rearing.enior Scientist of National Dairy Research Institute (NDRI), Dr. M.P.  Singh says that the productivity of animals depends on three factors.First, the genetic properties of the cow or buffalo breed, second - the weather in the area to be reared, nutrition and diseases of the animals.Third - the ability of animals to adapt to the conditions.Indigenous breeds give less milk, but they have greater ability to tolerate diseases and change in weather than hybrid breeds.

For small farmers, cows of indigenous breed giving good milk according to their region are suitable.Prominent among them are the cows of Sahiwal (1400.2500 liters of milk per annum), Lal Sindhi (1300.2200), Haryana (1200-1500), Gir (1400-1900), Tharparkar (1100-1900).In case of non-availability of pure breed cows, cows of some local hybrid breeds that provide more milk can be reared.The value of cows of all these breeds is determined according to their daily milk capacity.Their price will be around Rs 2,000 to Rs 2,500 per kg of milk.

Location selection required for dairy

The animals have to be reared according to the space available with small farmers.Generally 2.53 m  is needed for non-milch calf.Milking cows require up to 3.55 square meters.The shed should be ventilated and there should be room for hot air ventilation in between.If there is less space, the rivers can be made separately for the animals to eat.  According to the senior veterinarian Dr. Hemant Pant, the depth of the nad should be about 40 cm and there should be water in both corners of the nad.

Protection from diseases in animals

Dr. Hemant Pant says that there is usually a considerable outbreak of thanilla disease in dairy animals.This disease occurs due to lack of proper care.Animals can be protected from thalana disease with just a little care.  Due to Thanela disease, bad milk comes in the affected udder, which is added to the remaining milk to spoil the whole milk.To avoid this, always mix potassium permagnet (red medicine) in water in a mug before draining the milk and clean the udder thoroughly with this solution, then remove the milk.Cow's milk should be completely extracted daily.Failure to do so may cause infection.After removing the milk, clean the udder with dettol water, this reduces the chances of infection in the udder significantly.  Also, get the animals vaccinated on time, so that diseases like khurpaka-muhmpaka disease and gulagontu can be prevented.Prevent fleas and other parasites sticking to the animal's body.Give Grovel Agrovet medicines from time to time, which is quite effective.

Income from dairy farm

The income of farmers by producing cows and producing milk depends on several points.If the herdler has fodder for his farm, then the cost of rearing his cattle would be less.This will improve his income.But it is certain that if dairy is managed properly, then the diseases of animals will be able to avoid the hindrance in milk production.  Apart from this, the patient will also get relief from the cost of animal treatment.

No animal will be affected by infertility problem, do these measures

Animal infertility is responsible for major losses in dairy farming and dairy industry in India.Breeding of infertile animals is an economic burden and in most countries such animals are sent to slaughterhouses.1030 percent of cases of milking in animals can be affected by infertility and reproductive disorders.In order to achieve good breeding or high rates of calving, both male and female animals must be fed, fed and kept free from diseases.Any cow-buffalo should be reintroduced within 95 to 120 days after calving.If they are not conceiving, then it brings us into the category of infertility.There are many reasons for this.The main cause of infertility in animals is nutritional deficiency, it has been found that animals are unable to conceive due to lack of mineral elements and zinc.

So this is the reason for infertility of animals

Infertility of animals is responsible for major losses in dairy farming and dairy industry in India.Raising infertile animals is an economic burden and in most countries such animals are sent to abattoirs, the reasons for infertility are many and they can be complicated.  Infertility or failure to conceive a child may be due to malnutrition in the female, infection, congenital defects, management errors and imbalance of eggs or hormones.

Sexual cycle

Sexual (sexual arousal) of both cows and buffaloes is 18-21 once a day for 18-24 hours.But in buffalo, the cycle occurs stealthily and presents a major problem for farmers.Farmers should closely monitor animals 4-5 times from morning to late night.Inaccurate estimation of stimulation can increase the level of infertility.Estimating visual symptoms in excited animals is quite a skillful thing.Farmers who maintain a good record and spend more time watching animal movements get better results.

Tips to avoid infertility

Breeding should be done during arousal period.Animals that do not show sexual arousal or who are not having cycles, should be examined and treated.Once affected by insects, their health should be maintained once in six months of deworming.A small investment in most deworming can bring greater profits in obtaining dairy products.Animals should be given a well-balanced diet that supplies protein, minerals and vitamins with energy.It increases the rate of conception, ensures a healthy pregnancy, safe delivery, reduces the incidence of infection and helps in having a healthy calf.Taking care of young female calves with good nutrition helps them achieve puberty at the right time with optimal body weight of 230-250 kg which is suitable for reproduction and thus better conception.Giving sufficient amount of green fodder during pregnancy can protect newborn calves from blindness and (after birth) keep the placenta intact.It is very important to know the bull's reproductive history when serving in general to avoid congenital defects and infections of the calf.In utero infection can be largely avoided by serving cows in healthy conditions and producing calves.

Animals should be tested by qualified veterinarians for confirmation of pregnancy 6090 days after conception.  When conception occurs, the female enters a period of sexual apathy during pregnancy (not exhibiting regular sexual arousal), the gestation period is about 285 days for the cow and 300 days for the buffalo.Improper stress and transport should be avoided during the late stages of pregnancy.  Pregnant animals should be kept away from the common herd for better feeding and management and delivery care.

Pregnant animals should be completely weaned two months before delivery and should be given adequate nutrition and exercise.This helps in improving the health of the mother, breeding of a healthy calf with average weight, reduction in diseases and early withdrawal of the sexual cycle.

entry.title: Cultivate cashew and get fayeda
entry.content:
The origin of cashew is Brazil, from where it was brought to India in the late 16th century by the use of afforestation and soil conservation, this soil-inhibiting plant is the highest foreign exchange-earning crop after tea and coffee to date, dried fruits and nuts.Cashew has an important place in it, cashew is almost mandatory in snacks in all kinds of festivals and celebrations, especially in western countries.


The scope of cashew cultivation and its national importance

Cashew is commercially cultivated in eight states near the western and eastern coastline of the country - Andhra Pradesh, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, Maharashtra, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal, besides these, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat  Cashew is also cultivated in some areas of Meghalaya, Nagaland and Tripura, cashew is cultivated in an area of 9.53 lakh hectares (2010-11) in India and an estimated annual production of 6.74 lakh tonnes of raw cashew, Vietnam.  And after Nigeria, India is also the third largest consumer of cashew and the largest processor of cashew cultivation in the largest area.India's cashew production is 23% of the world's cashew production.A large number of small and marginal farmers, especially those living in the coastal areas, depend on cashew cultivation for their livelihood.Approximately 2 lakh workers, of which more than 90% are women, work in cashew factories.  These factories are mostly in Kerala, Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra.It is estimated that about two million people are directly and indirectly involved in cashew cultivation, processing and marketing.  Cashew farming is done in small and marginal holdings and more than 70% area of cashew cultivation is of this type, so it is clear that cashew has an important role in the development of small and marginal farmers.

Technical Requirements for Cashew Cultivation

Soil: The general belief is that cashew cultivation does not have to be very good soil and it adapts to different soil conditions and has no adverse effect on production, but the truth is that even if  Cashew will be cultivated in weak soil, but in better soil the crop will definitely be better.The soil best suited for cashew nut would be deep where there is no water logging, which is of sandy loam type and does not have hard surface under soil, cashew will also be produced in pure sandy soil but there is a possibility of lack of minerals in such soil.Soil is not suitable for cashew cultivation, which is of heavy type and does not have good drainage, soils with pH above 8.0 are also not suitable for cashew cultivation.  Cashew crops do not grow in highly alkaline or highly saline soils, red sandy loam, laterite and coastal sandy soils, which have a mild acidic pH, are best for cashew cultivation.

Climate: Cashew is a tropical plant and can grow at high temperatures.  New plants cannot tolerate extreme cold.  Cashew can be cultivated up to 700 meters above mean sea level, where temperatures do not fall below 20 degrees centigrade for long periods.  Such areas are ideal for cashew cultivation, with temperatures ranging from 20 to 30 degrees centigrade, and annual rainfall ranging from 1000 to 2000 mm.If the temperature is more than 36 degrees centigrade between the flowering and the planting of fruits, the plant does not bear fruit, and even then it does not survive.Rainfall that occurs throughout the year is not good for cashew, although plants can grow and sometimes bear fruit.For good production of cashew, it is necessary that the weather remains dry for a fixed period of at least 4 months of the year.  If during the flowering period, heavy rainfall, which is more moisture, then the flowers and fruits fall and the risk of fungal diseases increases.

Varieties of Cashew: Research done to improve cashew crop has found such planting material that it is possible to produce 20 to 25 kg of cashew from a cashew tree.  Several advanced varieties have been released in coordination with various centers of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research.Bud wood banks have been set up in all agricultural universities and research centers to increase the number of varieties released and distributed by the respective centers.

Plant material

Cashew is a hybrid pollinated crop and there is great diversity in cashew kernel, apple and productivity of seed-borne plants and hence flora propagation is advocated to bring uniformity in cashew.The method of earling has been quite successful, but the survival rate of such plants is quite low.They are more susceptible to drought than kalamis or seedlings and their lifespan is also relatively short.  In areas where the storm is more susceptible, such plants are more likely to fall. Epicotyl grafting and softwood grafting have been more successful as more methods can be prepared in less time than these methods.In order to meet the increased demand for cashew plant, the Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Cashew Research Council has prepared a large number of plants through standard techniques through cashew research directors, its sub-centers, University of Agriculture and horticulture / agriculture departments of the state.There is a lot of emphasis on  It is an economically profitable activity in most states.It takes less than 1 year to prepare plants in nursery.Farmers can buy saplings for nursery, but should be procured from authorized and certified nurseries.The plant suppliers should have such information about how long the plant is, what kind it is, what process (root stock) to use.Etc., and these information should be mentioned in the bill or cash memo.

Land preparation

In the agricultural land should be plowed properly and plowed, the forest area should be cleaned and the bio-waste should be completely burnt.  After this, the land should be given a terraced shape or, if the ground is very oblique, the ridges should be made.  Trenches should be dug throughout the contour to retain moisture.The cost of preparing the land will vary according to the size and type of land.Nowadays the use of JCB to fix the land has become very popular, so this cost is also included in this model.  The land reclamation work should be completed before the monsoon i.e. May-June.

Distance between plants

Cashew plants are planted in a square design at a distance of 7 to 9 meters.  By planting 7.5 meters, 175 trees per hectare can be planted.Whereas, planting trees at a distance of 8 meters brings 156 trees per hectare.This distance is better for cashew cultivation.It can also be done that initially plant 4 meters (625 plants per hectare) and by the tenth year gradually good plants get 8 meters.  This method gives higher yields in the initial years.It is better to plant in triangular design in more sloping ground.It is better to plant in triangular design in more sloping ground.This increases the number of plants by 15 percent and does not affect the growth and development of trees.If the ground is very low, trees should be planted along the banks of the contour and plots and pits should be made in place so that soil erosion does not occur and moisture will remain.

Digging and filling pits

The excavation of pits should be completed much earlier, ie by May - June.Cashew plants 60 cm long.  60 cm wide and 60 cm deep pitons are planted at normal levels.It is advisable to make pits of one meter length in hard laterite soil.The soil and the soil just below it and the soil just below it are kept separately so that both can get sunlight.This helps remove termites and ants.It is better to burn the waste of the forest in the pit before planting.  After this 5 kg of whole soil.Khetra compost or compost or 2 kg.Poultry manure or 200 grams of rock phosphate is mixed.Every pit contains 100 g of BHC with soil to protect against soil diseases.

To plant

Kalmi plants prepared from good quality root plants are planted as soon as the monsoon starts.To reduce the mortality of plants and their planting, it is imperative to support them with locally available wooden sticks and as required.  They should be planted on temporary roofs (in case of planting saplings in the forest, especially in the south-west areas).If the monsoon rainfall is not sufficient, the plant can be watered with a bucket twice to establish root.

Provision of humidity around the plant

Cashew plants are often planted on barren land, hence there is a lack of humidity.It is therefore necessary to keep the soil covered with black polyethylene to conserve humidity, in addition, if available locally, green or dry grass or weeds can be planted near the root.Small pieces of stone can also be poured into the basin to protect the humidity.The use of plastic or stone will not increase the quality of the soil, but the soil will remain humid and the plant will be protected from insect pests coming through the soil.

Farmyard manure and fertilizer

The use of fertilizers and fertilizers in cashew cultivation in our country is very limited.The soil should have a sufficient ratio of NPs for good yield.  The plant requires 10 to 15 kg of manure to ensure sufficient amount of organic matter in the soil.Fertilizers should be used immediately after the rain stops.Fertilizer should be applied in a circular trench along the edge of the drip line.Soil moisture should be ensured before use of fertilizers.

Removed

Light digging of soil should be done before the end of the India rainy season.  It is better to dig the weed around the plant and remove it from the root. If a sufficient number of workers are not available, this work can also be done using chemical.  For this, spraying of Agroder 96 (2, 4-D), 4 ml can be done in 1 liter of water followed by 5 ml of gramoxone in 2 liters of water.About 400 liters per hectare (160 liters per acre) of slurry will be required.  After the monsoon spraying will have to be done once more.

Taking other crops with cashew cultivation

When cashew plants are new, cultivation of varieties that go up to the height of sorghum and millets should not be encouraged as they have very high shade.Crops like groundnut and bin will be better.  If appropriate, fruits of small size trees like Anona and Phalsa can be cultivated which are grown in dry area.Crops like horse gram (Kulathi), cowpea (cowpea) and groundnut can be taken along with cashew cultivation.Simultaneous cultivation of cashew, casuarina and coconut is prevalent.

Ground crops

The quality of the soil is enhanced by legume as the nutrients for plants are increased and the amount of organic matter in the soil increases.Apart from this, it protects the soil and keeps the moisture in the ground.Sowing for such crops can be done before the onset of the low monsoon.By digging the soil lightly in the space between cashew plants in the casting ground and 30 cm X 30 cm.A layer of soil is added by adding seeds to the beds.  The seed is soaked in water for six hours before sowing.

Plant care and pruning

During the first years of planting the sap should be removed so that the plant grows strongly.These buds bring the nutrients of the plant to their use, so by removing them, the plant gets nutrients and reinforces it.  Cutting-pruning for 3-4 years is necessary to give the tree the right shape.Removal of lower branches and branches is not necessary for the first three-four years.The plant should be pruned till it grows as a single stem from the quarter to one meter from the ground.Weak and tangled branches should also be cut.It is necessary to give proper support to the plant so that it does not fall due to strong wind.  After 4-5 years, the main stem reaches 4-5 meters above the ground.After this, once in 2-3 years, the plant remains healthy by removing the dried twigs of the tree and the entangles.The necessary pruning and pruning of the plant should be done in August-September.Bordeaux paste should be applied from where it is harvested.

Potection from pests and diseases

Insects: It has been found that 30 species of insects are present in cashew nut.Prominent among these are T-Mosquito, Flower Thrip, Stem and Root Borer and Fruit and Nut Borer, causing a 30 percent loss in yield.

T-Mosquito: These insects (small and big) also lick the tender leaves of trees, green leaves and raw cashew fruit.  Its saliva is poisonous, which spoils the place where it licks.If a large number of new plants become infected with insects, they are at risk of dying.  The invasion of these insects can be remotely identified by the condition of the trees.The number of these insects increases greatly in the beginning of the rainy season.To protect cashew nuts from this pest, spraying of carbaryl, .1% or Fosalone.07% or dimethote.05 percent should be done once the new leaf is planted, once during the initial flowering stage, and once during planting.

Thrip: These insects (small and big) stick in the inner part of the leaves and feed them near the main vein, due to which the leaves become yellowish stains which later turn brown.Due to this, the color of leaves starts to be white.These insects occur in the dry season.These can be controlled by spraying monocrotophos.05% or carbaryl .1%.

Stem and root borer: These small white worms pierce the fresh tissues of the stem and root bark by feeding on the subepidermal tissues and making the tunnels inside the tree.The vascular tissue is severely damaged resulting in the flow of juice, weakening the stem.  It has special characteristics.Small holes in the collar region, gummosis, yellowish fall of leaves and drying of twigs.Once these insects are planted, it becomes impossible to remove them completely.Nevertheless, once in April-May and once in November, they can be controlled using 1 percent BHC.Worms that pierce the fruit: These worms pierce the fruits of cashew nut, which makes the cashew nut lighter and its shape worse.To avoid this, monocrotophos at the time of flowering and function should be sprayed with .05%.

Disease: Fortunately, cashew does not appear to have any serious disease.  The only problem of cashew is powdered mildew which is caused by a mildew.This disease affects new twigs and flowers and they worsen.This disease especially occurs in such a season when the sky is cloudy.The disease can be controlled by spraying 2% sulfur WP.

Cashew crop

The cashew trees start bearing fruit after 3 years which reach their maximum level in the 10th year and continue to get good yield for 20 years.  Cashew crop is taken after February and May.After ripening, the fruits that fall down have to be collected.But if cashew is to be used for making jams, juices, feni etc. then it is necessary to remove the fruit from the tree before it falls naturally.The cashew nuts are removed by removing their upper part and then the cashew nuts are taken out and dried in the sun for 2-3 days so that their humidity is reduced from 30 percent to 9 percent.To know whether cashew is fully prepared or not, it is put in water.The fruits in which cashew is ripe, they sit down in the water while the empty or raw cashew fruits keep floating.Cashew is collected at the interval of one week during the harvesting season.At that time a good cleaning of the ground under the tree is necessary which will facilitate the collection of fruits.Cultivated varieties of unintentional origin or in a conventional way produce less than one kg of raw cashew in a tree, while 4 to 5 kg can be harvested for 4-5 years using advanced technology.The yield can be increased from 8 to 10 kg per tree with the use of advanced technology along with the improved plant species.

Marketing

We have a processing capacity of about 7 lakh tons, while raw cashew nuts roast using open pot or earthen pot or rotating cylinder or hot oil talk method.The first two methods are easy and cheap but they take a lot of time and cashew shell liquids are easy and cheap but they take a lot of time and the cashew shell shell fluid (CNSL) is less.The method of roasting in a rotating cylinder is healthier and more efficient but a lot of CNSL is wasted.  The hot oil bath method is roasting and emits more CNSL content.The cleaned cashew nuts are placed in wire mesh baskets and immersed in CNSL filled tanks, in a temperature range of 180200 degrees Celsius, from 60 to 90 seconds.The CNSL has to be stirred continuously so that overheating does not occur and a large amount of polymer is not formed or cashew nuts are interlocked.This process is more cost effective and only a few professors use it.Rotating cylinders are most commonly used.  After roasting, the skin is removed from the hands and the nuts are removed.  The amount of cashew nuts increases when peeling off the machine.The cashew obtained in this way is dried in a hot air chamber from which the peel or test of the kernel is landed.Peels are removed with great care because they are very delicate at this time.Cashew shelling percentage ranges from 20 to 25

Grading and packing

Grading is done using exports based on the number of cashew nuts per pound.  Whole (whole) cashews and slice (split) cashews are separated.Whole cashew nuts are further classified as whole white kernel, hole scorched kernel, whole desert kernel (A) and whole desert kernel (B).  Similarly slice cashews are further classified as white pieces, scorched pieces, Desert pieces (A) and Desert pieces (B).The whole is packed to different grades, namely, 210, 240, 280, 320, 459, and 500, 320 being the popular grade.  Graded cashews should be fully grown, ivory-white in color, and free from damage caused by any kind of insects and must be immaculate.Cashew packing is done with the Vita pack method in which the packing is done with the Vita method in which air is removed from the packing tin and filled with carbon dioxide and the tin is sealed

Financial profitability and bank eligibility

Project Cost: Cashew tree starts bearing fruit in the third year but the income from it is not enough to meet the expenditure.Hence the cost up to 4 years is capitalized.The cost of cultivation of cashew in one hectare is Rs.  83.800 / - is estimated as given in Annex II.

Margin amount: 5 percent for small farmers, 10 percent for medium farmers and 15 percent for other farmers.The remaining cost will be given as bank loan for cashew cultivation.However, in the model given here, a margin amount of 10 percent was kept in it which is Rs. 8400 / - per hectare.

Bank loan: From financial institution 85% to 95% of the development cost will be received as bank loan.In this model, the bank loan is considered as 90%, which is Rs.It is 75400.

Interest Rate: Banks are free to set their own interest rate, keeping within the guidelines issued by Reserve Bank of India from time to time.However a 12% rate has been kept in the model project, which is the maximum possible rate.

Bail: As per the guidelines issued by Reserve Bank of India from time to time in this matter.

Financial analysis: Financial analysis has been done for cashew cultivation in one hectare.Income is kept down for financial analysis.The production of 9 kg of cashew from a 10-year-old cashew tree has been made the basis.  The calculation of income and expenditure of the project is shown in Annex III.IIR of model 44% NPW Rs.  1,39,588 and BCR 1.66 coming which are given in Annex IV.

Repayment period of the loan: The repayment schedule is prepared on the basis of cash flow which is given in Annex V.Repayment period of 9 years with grace period of 3 years is considered for repayment of principal.

The conclusion

Cashew cultivation is technically feasible, financially profitable and eligible for bank credit in the areas found suitable based on agro-climatic conditions.

Declaration of discharge

The views expressed in this model project are of a compulsory nature.  NABARD has no financial obligation to any person using it for any purpose.  Changes in actual costs and returns will occur due to the specific requirements of the projects.

entry.title: One-time hard work and earning income for 25 years Learn about pomegranate farming
entry.content:
A pomegranate plant grows as a tree in three to four years and a tree gives fruit for about 25 years.Also, according to the research so far, if the distance between two plants is reduced to increase productivity per hectare, there is no effect on the yield per tree.But due to having more trees, the production per hectare is about one and a half times.Traditional planting of pomegranate plants can only take 400 plants in one hectare whereas according to new research, planting five and three meters of pomegranate plants will not affect the flowering of the plants and one hectare  With six hundred saplings planted, the yield will increase by one and a half times.


How many fruits from a plant

A plant produces about 80 kg of fruit in a season.Accordingly, by reducing the distance, planting saplings gives fruits up to 4800 quintals per hectare.  Accordingly, a hectare can yield an annual income of eight-million rupees.  Even after extracting the cost, the profit will remain attractive.Using the new method increases the cost of fertilizers and fertilizers by just 15 to 20 per cent, while increasing yields by 50 per cent and avoiding other losses.  Reducing the distance between plants protects the plants from both strong heat and coolness due to microclimate, along with bird damage that reduces the damage to fruits from birds.Some farmers of Rajasthan have tried this method.  It has got better results.The best time to plant pomegranate plants is August or February-March.In such a situation, when planting the pomegranate plants in August during the Kharif season, then after three to four years, they will start giving fruits on the trees and once the investment will be benefited for many years.

Disease prevention method

Pomegranate plants are prone to fruit borer and insects rotting the plants.  For this, keeping cleanliness around the plant along with spraying of insecticide also prevents insects.  Summer season is not unfavorable for pomegranate plants, but sprinkling sulfuric acid is necessary to protect plants from frost in winter.Plants are protected from burning due to protection from frost by regular watering.During winter, there is a greater possibility of fruit bursting.  Therefore, the fruits can be saved by protecting the plants from cold.In this way, by planting pomegranate plants in kharif with other crops, the farmer can prepare an additional source of earning.

Manure use

To take pomegranate fruits in July-August, irrigate 150 grams in 3-year-old plants, 200 grams in four-year-old plants, 250 grams of urea per plant in five or more plants in the month of June.In small plants also give urea in this month.  Irrigate 50 grams in one year and 100 grams of urea per plant in two years.  By the way, pomegranate yield is also good in July-August and the market is also good.

Planting Time

The appropriate time to plant pomegranate plants is also August or February-March.If farmers plant pomegranate plants in August, then after three to four years, they will start bearing fruit on trees and once the investment is made, they will get benefits for many years.If the new method discovered by the researchers in planting pomegranate plant is used then the profit can increase further.

Distance in plants

To increase productivity per hectare, if the distance between two plants is reduced, there will be no effect on the growth of the plants and the yield will also increase by about one and a half times.A pomegranate plant is planted in a part of land five meters long and equally wide.Reducing the distance between plants protects the plants from both strong heat and coolness due to microclimate, along with bird damage that reduces the damage to fruits from birds.In summer, small plants need to be protected from birds.Plants should be covered with a net when they are about one and a half feet high.

Traditional planting of pomegranate plants can take 400 plants in a hectare whereas according to the new research, if the pomegranate plant is planted in five to three meters, there will be no effect on the flowering of the plants and one hectare  With six hundred saplings planted, the yield will increase by one and a half times.  A plant produces about 80 kg of fruit in a season.Accordingly, cultivation of pomegranate in the traditional way will produce 3200 quintals of pomegranate per hectare, while reducing the middle distance, planting per hectare will increase the yield per hectare to 4800 quintals.

The origin of cashew is Brazil, from where it was brought to India in the late 16th century by the use of afforestation and soil conservation, this soil-inhibiting plant is the highest foreign exchange-earning crop after tea and coffee to date, dried fruits and nuts.Cashew has an important place in it, cashew is almost mandatory in snacks in all kinds of festivals and celebrations, especially in western countries.

The scope of cashew cultivation and its national importance

Cashew is commercially cultivated in eight states near the western and eastern coastline of the country - Andhra Pradesh, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, Maharashtra, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal, besides these, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat  Cashew is also cultivated in some areas of Meghalaya, Nagaland and Tripura, cashew is cultivated in an area of 9.53 lakh hectares (2010-11) in India and an estimated annual production of 6.74 lakh tonnes of raw cashew, Vietnam.  And after Nigeria, India is also the third largest consumer of cashew and the largest processor of cashew cultivation in the largest area.  India's cashew production is 23% of the world's cashew production.A large number of small and marginal farmers, especially those living in the coastal areas, depend on cashew cultivation for their livelihood.Approximately 2 lakh workers, of which more than 90% are women, work in cashew factories.  These factories are mostly in Kerala, Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra.  It is estimated that about two million people are directly and indirectly involved in cashew cultivation, processing and marketing.  Cashew farming is done in small and marginal holdings and more than 70% area of cashew cultivation is of this type, so it is clear that cashew has an important role in the development of small and marginal farmers.

Technical Requirements for Cashew Cultivation

Soil: The general belief is that cashew cultivation does not have to be very good soil and it adapts to different soil conditions and has no adverse effect on production, but the truth is that even if  Cashew will be cultivated in weak soil, but in better soil the crop will definitely be better.The soil best suited for cashew nut would be deep where there is no water logging, which is of sandy loam type and does not have hard surface under soil, cashew will also be produced in pure sandy soil but there is a possibility of lack of minerals in such soil.Soil is not suitable for cashew cultivation, which is of heavy type and does not have good drainage, soils with pH above 8.0 are also not suitable for cashew cultivation.Cashew crops do not grow in highly alkaline or highly saline soils, red sandy loam, laterite and coastal sandy soils, which have a mild acidic pH, are best for cashew cultivation.

Climate: Cashew is a tropical plant and can grow at high temperatures.  New plants cannot tolerate extreme cold.  Cashew can be cultivated up to 700 meters above mean sea level, where temperatures do not fall below 20 degrees centigrade for long periods.  Such areas are ideal for cashew cultivation, with temperatures ranging from 20 to 30 degrees centigrade, and annual rainfall ranging from 1000 to 2000 mm.If the temperature is more than 36 degrees centigrade between the flowering and the planting of fruits, the plant does not bear fruit, and even then it does not survive.  Rainfall that occurs throughout the year is not good for cashew, although plants can grow and sometimes bear fruit.For good production of cashew, it is necessary that the weather remains dry for a fixed period of at least 4 months of the year.If during the flowering period, heavy rainfall, which is more moisture, then the flowers and fruits fall and the risk of fungal diseases increases.

Varieties of Cashew: Research done to improve cashew crop has found such planting material that it is possible to produce 20 to 25 kg of cashew from a cashew tree.Several advanced varieties have been released in coordination with various centers of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research.Bud wood banks have been set up in all agricultural universities and research centers to increase the number of varieties released and distributed by the respective centers.

Plant material

Cashew is a hybrid pollinated crop and there is great diversity in cashew kernel, apple and productivity of seed-borne plants and hence flora propagation is advocated to bring uniformity in cashew.The method of earling has been quite successful, but the survival rate of such plants is quite low.They are more susceptible to drought than kalamis or seedlings and their lifespan is also relatively short.In areas where the storm is more susceptible, such plants are more likely to fall.Epicotyl grafting and softwood grafting have been more successful as more methods can be prepared in less time than these methods.In order to meet the increased demand for cashew plant, the Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Cashew Research Council has prepared a large number of plants through standard techniques through cashew research directors, its sub-centers, University of Agriculture and horticulture / agriculture departments of the state.  There is a lot of emphasis on  It is an economically profitable activity in most states.It takes less than 1 year to prepare plants in nursery.Farmers can buy saplings for nursery, but should be procured from authorized and certified nurseries.The plant suppliers should have such information about how long the plant is, what kind it is, what process (root stock) to use.Etc., and these information should be mentioned in the bill or cash memo.

Land preparation

If the agricultural land should be plowed properly and plowed, the forest area should be cleaned and the bio-waste should be completely burnt.  After this, the land should be given a terraced shape or, if the ground is very oblique, the ridges should be made.  Trenches should be dug throughout the contour to retain moisture.The cost of preparing the land will vary according to the size and type of land.  Nowadays the use of JCB to fix the land has become very popular, so this cost is also included in this model.  The land reclamation work should be completed before the monsoon i.e. May-June.

Distance between plants

PCashew plants are planted in a square design at a distance of 7 to 9 meters.By planting 7.5 meters, 175 trees per hectare can be planted.  Whereas, planting trees at a distance of 8 meters brings 156 trees per hectare.This distance is better for cashew cultivation.It can also be done that initially plant 4 meters (625 plants per hectare) and by the tenth year gradually good plants get 8 meters.This method gives higher yields in the initial years.It is better to plant in triangular design in more sloping ground.It is better to plant in triangular design in more sloping ground.This increases the number of plants by 15 percent and does not affect the growth and development of trees.If the ground is very low, trees should be planted along the banks of the contour and plots and pits should be made in place so that soil erosion does not occur and moisture will remain.

Digging and filling pits

The excavation of pits should be completed much earlier, ie by May - June.  Cashew plants 60 cm long.60 cm wide and 60 cm deep pitons are planted at normal levels.It is advisable to make pits of one meter length in hard laterite soil.The soil and the soil just below it and the soil just below it are kept separately so that both can get sunlight.This helps remove termites and ants.It is better to burn the waste of the forest in the pit before planting.After this 5 kg of whole soil.Khetra compost or compost or 2 kg.Poultry manure or 200 grams of rock phosphate is mixed.  Every pit contains 100 g of BHC with soil to protect against soil diseases.

To plant

Kalmi plants prepared from good quality native plants are planted as soon as the monsoon starts.To reduce the mortality of plants and their planting, it is imperative to support them with locally available wooden sticks and as required.They should be planted on temporary roofs (in case of planting saplings in the forest, especially in the south-west areas).  If the monsoon rainfall is not sufficient, the plant can be watered with a bucket twice to establish root.

Protection from pests and diseases

Insects: It has been found that 30 species of insects are present in cashew nut.  Prominent among these are T-Mosquito, Flower Thrip, Stem and Root Borer and Fruit and Nut Borer, causing a 30 percent loss in yield.

T-Mosquito: These insects (small and big) also lick the tender leaves of trees, green leaves and raw cashew fruit.Its saliva is poisonous, which spoils the place where it licks.If a large number of new plants become infected with insects, they are at risk of dying.The invasion of these insects can be remotely identified by the condition of the trees.In the beginning of the rainy season the number of these insects increases greatly.

To protect cashew nuts from this pest, spraying of carbaryl, .1% or Fosalone.07% or dimethote.05 percent should be done once the new leaf is planted, once during the initial flowering stage, and once during planting.Thrip: These insects (small and big) stick in the inner part of the leaves and feed them near the main vein, due to which the leaves become yellowish stains which later turn brown.Due to this, the color of leaves starts to be white.These insects occur in the dry season.These can be controlled by spraying monocrotophos.05% or carbaryl .1%.

Stem and root borer: These small white worms pierce the fresh tissues of the stem and root bark by feeding on the subepidermal tissues and making the tunnels inside the tree.  The vascular tissue is severely damaged resulting in the flow of juice, weakening the stem.  It has special characteristics.Small holes in the collar region, gummosis, yellowish fall of leaves and drying of twigs.  Once these insects are planted, it becomes impossible to remove them completely.Nevertheless, once in April-May and once in November, they can be controlled using 1 percent BHC.

Worms that pierce the fruit: These worms pierce the fruits of cashew nut, which makes the cashew nut lighter and its shape worse.To avoid this, monocrotophos at the time of flowering and function should be sprayed with .05%.

Disease: Fortunately, cashew does not appear to have any serious disease. The only problem of cashew is powdered mildew which is caused by a mildew.This disease affects new twigs and flowers and they worsen.  This disease especially occurs in such a season when the sky is cloudy.The disease can be controlled by spraying 2% sulfur WP.

Cashew crop

The cashew trees start bearing fruit after 3 years which reach their maximum level in the 10th year and continue to get good yield for 20 years.  Cashew crop is taken after February and May.After ripening, the fruits that fall down have to be collected.  But if cashew is to be used for making jams, juices, feni etc. then it is necessary to remove the fruit from the tree before it falls naturally.The cashew nuts are removed by removing their upper part and then the cashew nuts are taken out and dried in the sun for 2-3 days so that their humidity is reduced from 30 percent to 9 percent.To know whether cashew is fully prepared or not, it is put in water.The fruits in which cashew is ripe, they sit down in the water while the empty or raw cashew fruits keep floating.Cashew is collected at the interval of one week during the harvesting season.At that time a good cleaning of the ground under the tree is necessary which will facilitate the collection of fruits.Cultivated varieties of unintentional origin or in a conventional way produce less than one kg of raw cashew in a tree, while 4 to 5 kg can be harvested for 4-5 years using advanced technology.The yield can be increased from 8 to 10 kg per tree with the use of advanced technology along with the improved plant species.
