entry.title: Due to good production, litchi farming is proving beneficial for the farmers
entry.content:
Due to good production, Lichi farming is proving to be beneficial for the farmers, Lichi is known as a fruit, which is called from the scientific name (Litchi Chinensis), is the only member of the genus litchi. Its family is SOPBARI. It is a tropical flame, whose original residence is China. It is commonly found in Madagascar, India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, South Taiwan, North Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, Philippines and South Africa.Lichi can also be successfully imposed in the form of intensive gardening, but it requires specific climate for its cultivation, which is in just a few areas of the country.So its farming is being very limited in the land. Lichi's gardening is most in Bihar. Apart from this, the Valley of Dehradun is done in Tarai region of Uttar Pradesh and Chhotanagpur area of Jharkhand. Based on the quality of fruit, the location of the litchi of Northern Bihar is still the head.

This is how litchi originated

Lychee is considered to be a native of southern China.Where it has been grown for centuries.Its arrival in eastern India dates back to the late 17th century and it gradually spread to other parts of the country.Its horticulture has proved successful in the northern part of Bihar state, especially around Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga district.It is also cultivated successfully in the foothills of the Himalayas in northern India.It is spread in Meerut, Saharanpur, Muzaffarnagar and Dehradun districts of Uttar Pradesh and Gurdaspur, Patiala, Bahadurgarh and Hoshiarpur etc.of Punjab.It also has horticulture in Bengal and some areas of Meghalaya.  It is also cultivated in lowland areas of northern India.Presently, its horticulture has started in parts of Chhattisgarh too.

This is how to prepare land for litchi

Land preparation is similar to planting a traditional garden.Graphing varies because in intensive horticulture, the distance from plant to plant and line to row is less than that of conventional gardening.It can also be applied like mango at 5 5 meters.All the types of land except fossil land which has a good amount of fossil material and good drainage so that litchi can be cultivated successfully.Smooth loam soil in which fossil material is good and water does not stay is best for litchi.Growth of trees is good in mild acidic land.In such land some lumps are found on the roots of litchi.  In which a fungus called mycorrhiza is found.Due to which the growth of trees is good.

Climate suitable for litchi

In winter, more frost and during summer, heat waves have to be beaten with litchi.New and - sometimes old leaves and twigs die from frost.  At the time of ripening of the fruit, due to the heatstroke, its fruit gets split.  As a result of which the fruits start deteriorating.In early varieties, the fruits get scorched by the sun's hard sun.And they also burst.Which is called Sunscald.This loss is more at that time.When the temperature exceeds 38 C and the humidity in the air decreases by 60 percent.Therefore, in those areas where the temperature exceeds 38 C and the humidity temperature is less than 60 percent, it is not possible to do cultivation successfully.Areas with temperatures below 38 C and 150 cm of rainfall where humidity is above 60 percent are ideal for litchi cultivation.

Plant planting

This work is also done like traditional gardening.The best time to plant saplings is the months of June and July.The distance from plant to plant and line to line should be kept 10 to 12 meters according to the fertile strength of the land.From the first week of May to June, pits of one meter diameter and one meter depth should be open for 8 to 15 days at a distance of 10 to 12 meters.After that, take equal quantity of soil and good rotten cow dung - equal to 2 grams of organic manure mixture and put the soil on the pit and solidify it and fill it again with a mixture of soil and fertilizer.Irrigation is necessary even after filling the pits. So that the soil of the pits should be solidified and then the plant can be planted in July. If the soil is smooth, then the soil should be mixed in equal quantity with the soil and sand.  .

Varieties of litchi

About 50 varieties of litchi are grown in India, but in some parts are called with different names.The main varieties grown in Bihar are - Purvi, Kasba, Shahi, China, Early Bedana, Red Mumbai etc. and a variety of varieties are grown in Uttar Pradesh and Bengal as well, so that the varieties of Bedana are characterized by having small seeds (  The shape of a log) and the amount of pulp is high.Pollination is necessary for the growth of the fruit.  It contains 14 percent sugar, while other varieties have only 1011 percent.

Diseases and prevention of litchi

Outbreaks of any type of disease or harmful pests are rare in Lychee.

Litchi Mite- This insect is found on the lower part of the leaves, which suck the juice of the leaves and the leaves become brown and velvety and its leaves are twisted and their decomposition increases so much that it turns completely  It becomes round.  Finally the leaves dry up.This pest can be seen on the litchi plant from March-July.

Prevention- Its velvet leaves should be broken and burnt carefully and the fallen leaves should also be collected and burnt and 0.05% parathion should be sprayed on its tree.

Mealybug- In outcrops of litchi and mango, this pest is found in the gardens.It sucks the juice from flowers and new seedlings.

Prevention- To prevent this pest, 0.05 percent parathion should be sprayed and good care should be taken to prevent birds and bats from coming.

Manure and water

The amount of manure in litchi plants depends on the growth of the fruit.  According to a recent report, 454 kg  For the growth of fresh fruits, 1.36 kg of potash, 455 grams of phosphorus, 455 grams of nitrogen, 342 grams of lime and 228 grams.Magnesium should be used.Irrigation for litchi should usually be done in summer.  If the humidity increases in the summer and the water holding capacity of the soil is good, then the amount of irrigation should be reduced and for small plants in summer, irrigating every week is beneficial.Irrigation should be regularized for 10-15 days at the time of growth of fruits.

Weeding hoeing

Litchi orchards should be cleaned with weeds which is essential for the health of the trees.Deep plowing or digging should not be done in the litchi orchard, as its roots are near the ground floor.

Harvesting of fruits

While plucking the fruits of litchi, the branch part should be cut from the bunch, which will result in the growth of branches with fruit growth next year.

Result and yield

In North Indian climate, shoots of litchi occur between January-October, but shoots in February produce more flowers.Litchi has three types of flowers.Male, hermaphroditic and false hermaphrodite, hermaphrodite and false hermaphroditic flowers in different varieties have 2026 percent.  Pollination in litchi is by bees.  Pesticides should not be used to maintain their activity.Pollination is more in the irrigated varieties, as well as bee keeping in or around their gardens.

link.title: Due to good production, litchi farming is proving beneficial for the farmers

entry.title: Lemon farming is the way to become a millionaire
entry.content:
Many types of farming can be done in fruitful crops, through which you can earn maximum profit.Today in these fruitful crops we are going to discuss with you about the cultivation of lemon, through which you can earn maximum profit.At the present time, traditional farming has not been a profitable deal. Farmers have left traditional farming and farmers have started doing other fields such as vegetable farming, flower farming, fruit farming, today there are many crops which can give us more profits than traditional farming.Where the cost is equal in agriculture, the benefit is not the same.  While you can earn good profits by applying low cost in other farming like growing vegetables, growing flowers, fruit farming etc. like lemon cultivation, guava cultivation, pomegranate cultivation and many other fruitful plants you can cultivate and make good profits.Can earn  If you are a small farmer, you have less land then you can earn lakhs of rupees per year by cultivating lemon.

So let's know about its climate and soil

Loam and sandy loam soil is suitable for citrus fruits.For these fruits 6 -6.5 Ph.Soil is best.Saline or alkaline soils and areas where water remains stagnant are not considered suitable for citrus fruits.It is necessary to do soil testing before planting the garden.

So let's now know about the species of lemon

Paper lemon

Kagzi lemon is the most cultivated variety in the Indian subcontinent, its peel is thin and most of the juice comes out of its lemon species, so it is very famous and the most valuable species in the market.You can get 25 kg to 120 kg of lemons throughout the year, Lemon farming is a very good source of income.If you are a small farmer and have small farming, then you can make a good profit by cultivating lemon.  

Parmalini Lemon

In this species of lemon, fruits come in the form of flakes.You can find 3 to 4 fruits in a bunch, the plant of this species is small and fruits are obtained in small quantities.

Vikram Lemon

On the lemon of this species, only fruits come in the group, that is, in the form of flakes, but it gets a little more fruit than 5 to 10 lemons.

Chakradhar Lemon

In this species of lemon, seeds are not found inside the fruit.For this reason, this lemon is slightly preferred.In 1 year, 50 kg of lemons can be obtained from the tree of this species.

Kumbha lemon

It has a lemon like shape, it is called Kumbhakath due to its pot-like shape, it is also known as Pakistani Lemon from some places 30 kg Lemon, from which species plant can you get every year
Apart from this, scientists have prepared many species of lemon, you can get very good quality fruits from the heart.

Trees are planted at this time

Lemon is grown from seed The right time to grow lemon from seed is from July to October.You can grow lemon from seed.You can plant lemon plant in your field if you have 1 year old plant after growing lemon from seed.Apart from the native species of lemon, grafted species are also planted in the garden so that you can get fruits very quickly. You can also take small lemon plants from the market and plant them in your garden from 10 to 30.  You can get
The correct time to plant lemon is June and July in North India. Before planting the lemon plant, prepare a pit.There should be 2 feet deep and 2 feet wide pit.In the hour, dung manure sand and neem cake should be used in appropriate quantity so that after planting the plant, it should get proper growth.

Use manure in this way to cultivate lemon

You can use cow dung manure, compost compost and vermicompost on a large scale in lemon crop.On an average 3 year old plant you can give 5 kg, vermicompost, dung fertilizer according to the plant before flowering twice a year. 250 gram DAP 150 gram NPK once a year if the lemon plant is more than 10 years old.  You can apply it in your lemon plants.

This is the process of irrigation in farming

Irrigate the garden immediately after transplanting.Small plants up to 5 years old can be irrigated with a circle around them.While irrigation is done by filling water around old plants or making drains.Irrigation should be done at a difference of every 10 or 15 days in summer season and every 4 weeks in winter season.Irrigation is rarely required during the rainy season.  There should be adequate arrangement to remove excess rainy water during this season.While doing irrigation, make sure that the irrigation water does not come in contact with the main trunk of the tree.For this, a small dull soil can be made around the main stem.The drip irrigation method is the best.By this, water saving fertilizers are used, with Bimira being less.

Mahu disease 

Mahu is one of the most damaging insects in lemon.It attacks in March and dries the leaves of the plant by sucking the juice and drying them. The production of lemon can drop by 80% when the attack of Mahu occurs.Pest should be prevented; Many pesticides are available in the market for prevention of moth. You should spray any good pesticide on lemon plant twice a month in case of flowering.

Canker disease

In this disease, the leaves of lemon begin to appear light yellow in the beginning, which gradually grow to brown color.The branches of the plant start drying up.And finally your plant dries up.This disease is found only in lemon.For the prevention of this disease, branches suffering from the disease should be cut and taken away from the garden and medicine should be given.For the prevention of this disease, the plant should be bathed periodically and sprayed with neem leaves after making a pesticide.Apart from this, Lemon in the lemon, the lemon's worm, butterfly Ebutati disease and many minor diseases keep coming from time to time. Cleaning of lemon plants is most important from time to time if you keep cutting old dry branches in time.  This disease will harm your plants.

Weeding hoeing

Gardens with citrus fruits should never be plowed deeply.Because the roots of these trees reside in the upper surface of the ground and there is a danger of their destruction by deep plowing. Prevention of weeds in gardens is better.Broad leaf weeds and annual grasses can be destroyed by spraying up to 7.510 kg per hectare of syngene or 2.5 liters of gramexone in 500 liters of water.

Pruning of plants

For good growth of plants, their pruning starts from the stage of the beds.Almost all the upper and outlying branches of the plant should be pruned and thus a clean and straight stem of about 45 cm length should be allowed.  All disease-prone broken branches and dry wood twigs should be released on time.The shoots originating just below the place where the Kali pair is, should be given air in their initial state.In places where branches have been cut, apply a paste of chemical called Borodox.This paste can be prepared by mixing one kg of copper sulfate, 1.5 kg of extinguished and 1.5 liters of water.

entry.title: Banana crop means profitable deal in leguminous crop
entry.content:
Banana is a very nutritious fruit, which most people like very much.Even on the scale of nutrition value, a banana is 100 percent.Bananas contain a lot of vitamins, nutrients, such as vitamin A, B12A B6AC, D, iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, protein, carbohydrates, sugar, etc., which are present in a lot of energy, which can increase the demand for bananas.  Increase a lot.With this, there is good demand for banana throughout the year.But this high demand will benefit the farmers only when they produce maximum quality bananas.Banana is an important crop throughout the world.Banana is cultivated in about 4.9 lakh hectares in India, producing 180 lakh tons of production.Maharashtra has the highest production of bananas.
Jalgaon district alone accounts for 70 percent of Maharashtra's total banana area.Around 24 per cent of the total banana production in the country comes from Jalgaon district.Banana is said to be the fruit of the poor.  Banana is a major edible fruit in countries like Kerala State and Uganda due to high nutritional value of banana.The importance of banana cultivation is also increasing day by day due to the increasing demand for banana products.Banana Chips, Banana Fig, Banana Flour, Banana Papad, Banana Pudding, Banana Juice, Banana Pulp, Banana Fruit Canning, Banana Taffy, Banana Liqueur, Banana Champagne etc.are prepared.

Land and climate suitable for banana production

Warm and humid climate is suitable for the production of banana.Banana cultivation can be done well where the temperature ranges between 20-35 degree centigrade.Annual rainfall 150-200 cm  Should be distributed evenly.It is also produced in cold and dry climate.But frost and hot winds (lu) etc.cause a lot of damage.For banana cultivation, Batiui to Matiyar loam land is suitable.Which should have pH values of 6.5-7.5 and proper drainage.  Banana cultivation cannot be done in more acidic and alkaline soils.The water level of the land should be below 7-8 feet.

So let's now know about some species of banana

(1) Dwarf Cavendis- (Bhusavali, Basrai, Marisas, Kabuli, Sindurani, Singaporean Jahaji, Morris) This species has been found very suitable for the climate of Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Bihar and Karnataka.Selecting from this species, castes named Gandevi selection (Hanuman) or Padrese have been developed, whose production capacity is 20-25 km.G  Per plant.The plant of this species is 1.5 to 1.8 meters high of the sow variety, the fruit is large, beige yellow or greenish yellow.The stem mouta is greenish yellow.The leaves are broad and yellow, on an average there is 9-10 hands per bunch (bunch).The average finger length is 20 cm  And thickness 10 cm  it occurs.

(2) Robusta (AAA) - It is grown in different provinces under the name Bambegreen, Harichal, Bojihaji etc. This species has been planted from the Western Deep group.The height of the plants is 3-4 meters, the stem medium is green in color.There are fertile flowers in 10-19 hands per plant in which green finger develops.Bunch weighs on average 25-30 kg.Fruits are more sweet and attractive.The fruit turns bright yellow on ripening.This species is greatly affected by Singatok (leaf spot) disease.The storage capacity of fruits is low.

(3) Rasthali (Silk AAB) - This species is grown commercially in various states under the names Malabhog Amrit Pani Sonkela Raswale etc.The height of the plant is 2.5-3.0 m. Flowering starts only after 12-14 months.The fruit (finger) is thick with four angles of greenish green yellow.The peels are thin which after cooking become golden yellow in color.  Banana bunches weigh 15 to 20 kg.  The fruit is very tasty with some sweet like savory ripe apples.  Banana peel is thin like paper, this species has low storage capacity.

(4) Poovan (AB) - It is known as Chini Champa, Lal Velchi and Kadali Kodan. Its Pugha cylindrical is 2.25 - 2.75 meters in medium height.  Flowering starts 910 months after planting.  There are 10-12 hands in it.Each hand has 1416 fingers, the fruits are small cylindrical and have a raised beak.The pulp of the fruit is white and solid like ivory.It can be stored for a longer period of time.The fruits do not break apart from the bunches even after ripening.

(5) Karpuravalli (ABB) - It is known by the names Bontha, Bensa and Keshkal etc.This variety has been found suitable for planting in the kitchen garden.Its plant is 10-12 feet long.The stem is very strong.Fruits are planted in flakes.There are three rinse (bulge) on the fruit.A plant has 5-6 claws with 60-70 fruits.Their weight is 18-20 kg.  gram.it happens.Fruits are thick pointed and greenish yellow.It is the most suitable species for making chips and powder.

(6) Neendran (Planten AAB) - It originates from South India.  It is also called vegetable banana or rajeli.  It is most used in making chips.  Its plant is cylindrical to medium thick and 3 meters in height.There are 4-6 hands in bunch and 8-14 fingers in each hand.  Fruit 20 cm  It is long, bark thick and slightly folded and triangular.When the fruit is raw, it is yellow.But the skin becomes hard on cooking.It is mainly used for making chips and powder.

Land preparation and planting method

By plowing the field, the soil should be made bhur-bhuri so that the drainage of the land is proper and organic manure is abundant in the form of humus and for this, take green manure crop.
Plant interval - the distance of the queue from 1.8 meters to 1.5 meters is the distance from plant to plant and for planting saplings 45 * 45 * 45 cm.M  Pits of size 12-15 kg in each pit.  Add 5 grams of Thimet medicine to the soil in every pit as well before planting well cooked cow dung or compost manure.
Seed treatment- Clean the rhizomes before treatment and clean the roots by preparing 1% Bordeaux mixture and treat the rhizomes, after that make a solution of 3-4 grams of Babistin per liter of water and cure the rhizomes for 5 minutes.

Planting Time

1. Mrig Bahar (Summer) April to May
2. Kanda Bahar October

The summer production of deer bahar (summer) gives more production than Kanda Bahar.

Quantity and method of giving fertilizer and fertilizer

Planting banana crop in its entire life cycle, within 5 - 7 months, 200 gm per plant, Sphur 40-50 gm and potash 250-300 gm, compost compost 5 kg.  And give the cake of cotton or mahue per pugha.At the time of planting a full quantity of compost manure and phosphorus, give nitrogen and potash seven to eight times within a period of seven to eight months.

International Crop:

Mrig Bahar- This crop is planted in May-June.In which one can take banana, moong, okra, tomato, chilli, brinjal etc. with banana.
Kanda Bahar- Potatoes, onions, tomatoes, coriander, brinjal crops can be taken under this spring.

Harvesting activities in banana crop- In banana crop it is necessary to plant soil on the roots of plants.Because banana roots do not go too deep.That is why it is necessary to offer soil to support the plants.Sometimes the tubers come out.Due to which the growth of the plant stops.Therefore it is necessary to plow the soil.

Mulching

Water evaporation from the ground and weed loss by weeds.And nutrients are also taken from the soil by the weeds.Applying plastic seats around the roots of the plant to prevent evaporation of ground water and control of weeds protects against above damage.Apart from this, water loss is reduced by cane peels, dry grass, dry leaves and hoeing.  Productivity increases when mulching of plastic black polythene.
To remove the sucker- Continue cutting the sucker regularly till the flower plant is able to come out in the banana plant.  When the flower is complete, place a sucker and keep cutting the rest.Keep in mind that only a circus with one plant allowed to grow for a period of one year will produce it as a herd (retun) crop, the male part which is in the lower position of the bunch is cut and put bordopest in it.  .

Support- Varieties in which the weight of the bunches is considerable.And there is a possibility of pseudostem rupture.It should support the ball, its banana should be covered with a banana leaf.

Cutting of the plants- Banana bunches are reapable from flowering in 110 to 130 days.After cutting the bunches, cut the plants slowly, because by this activity, the nutrients of the mother plant start being available to the planters.The probability of good crop production increases.

Water Management - Banana crop requires more water.Banana leaves are very wide.The total area of leaves of a plant is 50-60 sqm.Therefore bananas require more water due to large scale evaporation emissions of water.  Fully grown bananas require 12-15 liters of water per day.Irrigation with drip method saves 60 percent water.

So do crop protection

1 Panama built or rough disease- This disease is caused by a fungus called Fusarium oxysporum.The leaves of the plant begin to wither and the whole stem of the banana bursts. Initially the leaves turn yellow from the edges. The affected leaves are twisted from the stalk, the affected yellow leaves stem  Hanging like a skirt around the base of the stem (lower part) is the major symptom of the disease.  Baschooler tissue turns yellow, red and brown in roots and rhizome; the plant becomes weak.  Due to which the flowering function does not occur.The fungal disease of this disease lasts for a long period in the condition of favorable temperature, humidity and pH.

So control this

1.By adopting the crop cycle of sugarcane and sunflower, the disease outbreak is reduced.

2.Suckers should be immersed in a 0.2 percent babistin solution for 30 minutes before applying.


3. Trichoderma biridi biological fungicide should be used.

4. Good control of the disease has been observed by filling 50 g of babistein in gelatin capsules with a capsules applicator at 45 degree angle in the tuber.

2 Leaf Spot (Singatoka) - This disease is caused by Pseudosarcospora mucus fungus.Outbreaks of this disease cause chlorophyll deficiency in the leaves.Because the tissue turns green to brown.Gradually the plant starts drying up.Initially small spots appear on the leaves.Then they turn into yellow or green yellow stripes.  In the end, the leaves are visible on both the surfaces, these stripes turn brown and black.  The area between the spots dries up.

So control this

The affected dry leaves should be cut and burnt.Spraying fungicides such as Diethane M.45, 1250 g hectare or Babistein 500 g ha or Propiconazole 0.1 per cent spray with Tipol 3-4 sprays 2-3 months from the month of October can be used to control the disease.

3.Anthracnose- This disease is spread due to fungus called Colletrotraicum musae.This disease occurs in the banana plant at the time of growth.  Symptoms of this disease appear in the form of small black spots on the leaves, flowers and peels of the plant.  The outbreak of this disease is more from June to September because the temperature is more at this time.

Control

1. Spraying of Prochlorox 0.15 percent or Carvendism 2 grams per liter of water.
2. Banana should be cut at 3/4 maturity.

3. appendicitis- (Banchitap) - irregular deep; morsecodded stripes with secondary veins of the inner midrib of the leaves appear as signs of onset.  These unusual symptoms occur in dark lines with irregular edges of an inch or more long.  The upper end of the plants takes the form of a bunch.  Leaves become small and narrow.  The edges turn upwards.  Stalks remain small and dwarf plants and do not bear fruit.  The carrier of the virus of this disease is the Mahu called Pantolonia nigronarvosa.

Control

1. Plants with disease should be removed and destroyed.
2. For disease control pest control, spraying of Metamistox 1.25 ml or Demacron 0.5 ml drug per liter of water should be done.
3. Choose disease-free sucker.

4. Banana stripe virus disease- Due to this disease, initially small yellow spots on the leaves of plants which later turn into golden yellow stripes.  Chlorotic stripes become necrotic with a black appearance on the lamina of the leaves.  The absence of siege and very small siege and seed development in fruits are the main symptoms of affected plants.  The virus of this disease is spread by Milbug and Plenococcus citri.

Control

The affected plants should be removed and destroyed and for control of mealybug, one and a half kilogram grams of carbofuran should be applied per acre.

Pests and their control

(1) Banana rhizome borer (Rhizome bibil) - This insect pierces the banana rhizome.  Worm pierces it within the rhizome.  But she is not visible from outside.  Sometimes it also pierces the pseudostem of a banana.  These holes cause decay.

Control- Before applying the rhizome, treat it by immersing in a 0.5% monocrotophos slurry for 30 minutes.  Spray 0.03% phosphomidan solution in case of severe outbreak.
(2) Stem clitoris- The female of the stem clitoris lays eggs in the stalks of adult leaves.  From which the worm comes out and eats leaves and stem.  Initially the sap appears to come out of the stem of the plant.  Then from the hole made by the larvae of the insect, the dirty substance drips droplets on the stalk of the leaves, which makes the floral promodia coming out inside the stem becomes dry.  Its outbreak occurs throughout the year.

Control- 1. Mix 150 ml of monocrotophos in 350 ml water and inject into the stem

2. After cutting the sap, the plants are cut off from the ground and sprayed with insecticide Carvoril 2 gm per liter water solution and eggs and insects are destroyed.

(3) Mahu- This insect sucking the juice of banana leaves damages them.  And benchita is the main carrier to spread the virus.  The color of this Mahu is brown.  Which suck the juice from the lower part of the leaves or the top part of the plant.

Control: Spray a solution of phosphomidan 0.03% or monocrotophos 0.04%.

(4) Thrips- Three types of thrips cause damage to the banana fruit (finger).  Thrips affected fruits are brown, colorless, black and small in size.  Although it does not have any effect on the pulp of the fruit, but the market price of it does not get right.

Control: Sprinkle with 0.05% solution of monocrotophos and cover the bunches with thick blanket cloth to reduce pest infestation.

(5) Les Vingus Bug - This insect is found in all banana growing areas.  Leaves affected by this insect turn yellow.  They suck the juice by staying at the bottom of the leaves.
Control: Spray 1.5 ml of monocrotophos drug per liter of water.

(6) Leaf-eating Worm- The worm of this insect eats open leaves of new small plants.  Makes new holes in the leaves.Control- Effective control has been observed by spraying Thyodan 35 EC on leaves (1.5 ml per liter of water).

entry.title: Learn the benefits of grapes in leguminous crops
entry.content:
If we talk about crops, farming is also done in large quantities of fruits and today we are talking to you about grape cultivation.Grapes have special significance in the fruits of the subtropical tropics of the world. In our country around 620 BC.At the same time, commercial cultivation of grapes in tropical areas had developed into a profitable venture, but commercial production in northern India gradually started very late.Today grape has also made its place as an important fruit in North India and its area is increasing rapidly in these areas.In the last three decades, grape cultivation has progressed in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Delhi and Western Uttar Pradesh due to which the production, productivity and area of grapes in India are increasing more than expected.



Soil and climate for grape cultivation

The root structure of grapes is quite strong.Hence it thrives successfully in sandy, sandy to smooth and shallow to deep soils but sandy, loamy soil with good drainage has been found suitable for grape cultivation.It is better not to cultivate it in more clay soil.The grape is somewhat tolerant to salinity.  Climate has a great impact on the development of the fruit and the texture and properties of the ripe grape.Warm, dry, and long summers are favorable for its cultivation, rain or cloud is very harmful when grapes are ripened, it causes rash and affects the quality of fruits.Hence, early maturing varieties are recommended in North India.

Types of grapes

1.Purple
2.Booty Seedless
3.Pusa Seedless
4.Pusa Navrang

Promotion of grapes

The grape is propagated mainly by cutting pens.In January, the cuttings are taken from the twigs produced from the pruning crop.Kalme should always be taken from healthy and mature twigs.Generally 23-45 cm long buds with 4 - 6 bales are taken while making the kalam, keep in mind that the bottom cut of the pen should be just below the knot and the top cut should be slant.These cuttings are well prepared and put in high beds from the surface.One year old root cuttings are released from nursery in January and planted in the field.

Transplanting vines

Make sure to do soil testing before transplanting, but prepare the field well.The middle distance of the vine depends on the particular and method of cultivation.Keeping all these things in mind, after digging the pits of 90 c 90 cinnamon, they get 1/2 part soil, 1/2 part of rotten manure and 30 grams of chlorpyrifas, 1 kg.Super phosphate and 500 grams of potassium sulphate, etc.should be mixed well and filled.Put 1 year old root cuttings in these pits in the month of January.Watering is necessary immediately after planting the vine.

Vines sorting

For the grape vine, pandals, barber, telephone, niphin and head etc.are popular methods, but on the commercial side, the pandal system has proved more useful to handle the vines by pandal system on the wire mesh with the help of concrete poles at 2.1 - 2.5 meters height.The vines are spread.Only one warp is made to reach the trap.Upon reaching the wire mesh, the trunk is cut so that the lateral branches grow.On the grown primary branches 60 cm in all directions are developed as second lateral branches.In this way, 8 - 10 tertiary branches will develop from secondary branches, these branches bear fruit.

sorting out

To get a consistent and good harvest from the vines, pruning at their proper time is very important.When to prune- Pruning can be done when the vine is in a dormant state, but the process must be completed before the bud grows.Generally, pruning is done in the month of January.

Irrigation

Irrigation is not required from November to December as Bel is in Susupta stage but irrigation is necessary after pruning.Water is required till the flowering and full fruit (March to May).Because of the shortage of water during this time both production and quality are affected.  During this time, keeping in view the temperature and environmental conditions, irrigation should be done at intervals of 7 - 10 days.Water should be stopped as soon as the fruit ripening process starts, otherwise the fruits can burst and rot.An irrigation must be done even after harvesting of fruits.

Manure and fertilizer

Grape vine receives a lot of nutrients from the ground.Therefore, in order to maintain soil fertility and to have a consistently good quality crop, it is necessary to supply nutrients by fertilizers and fertilizers.Done with pandal system and 3 * 3 m.  In a 5-year vine vine, 500 grams of nitrogen, 700 grams of muriate of potash, 700 grams of potassium sulfate and 50.  60 kg  Dung manure is required.

Fertilizer has to be given at this time

Immediately after pruning, in the last week of January, half of the nitrogen and potash and all of the phosphorus should be given.Give the rest only after bearing fruit.Irrigate immediately after mixing fertilizers and fertilizers in the soil.Pour the manure away from the main stem at a depth of 15-20 cm.

How to improve fruit quality

Good quality eating grapefruit should be medium sized, medium to large sized seedless grains, having distinct color, aroma, taste and texture.These characteristics generally depend on the particular species.But the following methods can also improve the quality of grapes more than expected.

Crop determination

Sorting is the cheapest and simplest means of crop fixation.More fruits leave a bad impression on the quality and ripening process.Therefore, it is better if 60 - 70 flakes are left on the bobar method and 12 - 15 flakes are left on the vines on the 

Ring method

In this technique, some parts of the bale are taken off as bark rings of 0.5 cm width from the branching subdermal or stem.When to bark depends on the purpose.In order to have more fruit, one week before flowering, bark should be taken at the beginning of fruit ripening immediately after planting to improve fruit size and for better attractive color.The bark is usually 0.5 cm on the main stem.  Choudi should be taken off as soon as it starts bearing fruit.

Using surge controllers

Using gibberlic acid in seedless varieties makes Dano double.On the flowering of Pusa seedless variety, 45 ppm 450 ml.Per 10 l.Beauty seedless in water should be used for 45 ppm in half bloom and 30 ppm in perlate variety.The gibberellic acid solution is either sprayed or the bunches are immersed in this solution for half a minute.If the bunches are immersed in ethephon in 500 ppm 5 ml per 10 liters of water, there is a lack of acidity in the fruits  The fruits ripen quickly and the color varie

Fruit Harvesting and Production

 Grapes do not ripen after plucking, so when they become edible or are to be sold in the market, they should be broken at the same time. Increase in sugars and decrease in acidity are the symptoms of ripening.Classify the bunches to take.Remove the broken and rotten grains from the bunches before packing.After three years, fruits start growing from a well-maintained garden of grapes and fruits can be obtained for 2-3 years.30 - 35 tonnes of fruit can be taken from 14 to 15 years old garden of Parylet variety and 15 - 20 tonnes per hectare from Pusa Seedless.

Learn mango cultivation and its benefits in leguminous crops Mango is cultivated almost all over the country.It is considered to be the very sweet fruit of man, in it it is found sweet with sourness.  According to the different species, there is less sweetness in the fruits.Raw mango to chutney pickle is used as a variety of drinks.Jelly jam syrup etc. are made with this.It is a good source of vitamins A and B.The common and common fruit of India is easily grown in almost every province.Due to its taste, aroma and complexion, it is called the king of fruits.Ripe fruits of mangoes are tasty, nutritious and healthy.Apart from the use of fresh ripe fruits, many preservatives are made from m

Essential for mango crop

Deep, sandy, loam soil with good water holding capacity is suitable for mango crop gardening.Deep black soil is unsuitable for this.The pH value of the land should be 5.5 to 7.5 and the depth should be at least 1 to 1.5 meters.  Mango is a plant with warm climate.  It is easily 1100 m above sea level.Can be grown at a height of up to.  24 cm for mango  From 37 cm  Has a good temperature.At the time of flowering, excessive rainfall, frost and frost are not suitable for mangoes.Higher temperature during fruit growth is good for fruit quality.

Advanced varieties

More than 1000 varieties of mango are grown but 40-50 varieties are suitable from commercial point of view.Some of the major varieties are as follows.

1. Amrapali (Dushari - Neelam) - This is a hybrid variety whose plants are dwarf and this variety is suitable for intensive gardening.Its fruits are small in size but grow every year.It is a late ripening variety in which fruits ripen in late June.In intensive horticulture, it yields 200 - 250 quintal hectare.

2. Mallika (Neelam - Dussehri) - This is a hybrid variety whose fruits are very large (average weight 500 grams).  The color of the fruit is pink-yellow, kernels pulp, sweet and delicious.  It is a regular fruiting variety. 

4. Langa - It originated in a village near Banaras.This variety fruits from the last May to the end of July.The tree is of a spreading nature and the head is rounded.  The fruit is medium sized oval to green in color, fiberless pulp and small kernels.The storage capacity of fruits is low.Its average production is up to 150-200 kg per tree.

5. Sundaraja- It is a medium-ripening variety whose origin is Rewa.The fruit is of medium size, weight 200-250 grams, italic, oval, yellow in color, fragrant and delicious.It is highly susceptible to Bandha disease (Mango malformation).

6. Gajaria - This is the main variety of Betul.Fruit medium to large, oblong, base slightly flattened, apex rounded, yellowish-green on ripening color, white spots on the skin, the skin is medium to thick, pulp juicy and very sweet.It has a pineapple-like aroma and is similar to pulp carrot because it is called carrot.The ripening time is from mid-May to last June.

 7. Dahiyad- It is a juicy variety of Bhopal whose fruit is medium size, italic, oval, top rounded broad, yellowish green rind is thick, pulp juicy, sweet, light yellow filament free.Due to the mixed aroma of sugar in yogurt, it is called dahiyad.

 8. Bombaygreen- It is an early maturing variety, the fruits of which are ripened in the third week of May.  Trees of this variety are more branched and have thinner leaves.The fruit is medium in size, green to green on ripening.Yellow, the amount of pulp in the fruit is good and the taste and sweetness are good.

9. Alfanzo - It is a popular variety of Ratnagiri (Maharashtra).Fruit size is medium (weight 250g), pulp is soft, fiberless, color orange, taste is sour sweet.A deformity called spongy tissue is found in it.It has good storage capacity and is suitable for export.

 So do the planting of mango plant-

Plant mango plants at a distance of 10 * 10 meters.But in intensive horticulture, apply it at a distance of 2.5 to 4 meters.Before planting saplings, make sure the location of plants by drawing in the field.Dig a pit of 1 * 1 * 1 meter size to plant.In the month of June, before the commencement of rains, 20 - 30 kg of cow dung, 2 kg of neem cake, 1 kg of bone powder or single super phosphate and 100 grams.Dust (10) of Methyl Paramithione or 20 g Themet 10. G mixed with the top surface soil of the field and fill the pits well.After raining two or three times, when the soil is suppressed, then with the help of a khurpi, place a pindi shaped plant in the previously identified location.  After planting the plant, press the surrounding soil th

This is how to take care of mango plant-

 Maintenance of mango plant is necessary for its proper function and complete production.After planting the plants, irrigate until the plants are fully established.Irrigate for the first two to three years to protect from heat stroke.Remove branches up to 80 cm in height from the ground, so that proper growth of the main stem can occur.No branch should emerge from below the grafting location.Let the top 3-4 branches grow.In dense trees with large beeches, cut the non-fruiting middle branches.After plucking the fruits, cut the twigs 2-3 cm along with the manger so that healthy branches come out.There will be good function in the next season.

 This is how fruit trees nourish-

Give manure and fertilizer in mango plants as follows -  Year cow dung (kg) Neem cake (kg) Eurya (gram) Single super phosphate (gram) Murate of potash (gram) 1. 1 to 3 25 2 200 150 150 2. 4 to 10 40 3 900 800 600 3  After 10 years 75 3 2000 1500 800 Note- Change the amount of fertilizer and fertilizer m.Irrigation and water harvesting- For the proper growth of the plants, irrigate at an interval of 12-15 days in winter season and 8-10 days in summer season till the mango plant comes to function.Do not give water till the fruits are produced before two months before arrival of manjar or baur.If you are growing any other crop along with mango then irrigate only as per the requirement of mango plants or choose a crop which does not require irrigation at the time of irrigation of mango.Plants require more water during fruiting, so irrigating them with mango fruit of pea size size increases the function and quality.Apply drip irrigation method for irrigation.

Complementary plants and inter-mango trees: It takes about 10-12 years for the mango tree to be fully prepared.Therefore, in the initial years, among the mango plants, plant other fruit plants, pulses or vegetables in the vacant land and take additional benefits and increase the fertility of the land.  Plant guava, lemon, pomegranate, papa

Flowering and flowering - Flowering starts in 3-4 years in plants grown by vegetative method.Pollination in mangoes is by insects.Therefore, do not use pesticide chemicals during flowering, otherwise fruit production will be affected.In plants, the function increases with age.Generally 15-20 years old plant produces maximum fruits.To get average size fruits, cut about 30-40 percent fruits.

So save the plant like this

Plant protection is ensured by controlling pests and diseases under plant protection.These are:

 Pest control

Mango hopper (Mango hopper) - Outbreak of this insect occurs in February and March.Adult insects are light brown in color with black and yellow lines on their body, the head is large and the body is pointed at the back.The baby of the insect has white and red eyes which later turn yellow.  Both infants and adults suck the juice of flowers and leaves.As a result, flowers and fruits start falling.The insects emit sticky juices which spread on the leaves and black mold is produced.Due to which the photosynthesis of the plant is reduced and the plants become weak.

So control

To control this pest, spray 0.04% solution of phosphomidon.
Mango Funga (Found bug) - The color of insect's body is red, head, wings, legs and antini are black.The head is short, black, without face.The body of the female insect is soft, light brown with some redness.Which appears white due to being covered with wax.  Ten sections are clearly visible in the abdomen.Pests are first found in thousands in November near the roots.  In the month of February, the nymphs suck the juice from new twigs, blossoms of blossom, causing flowers and fruits to fall.

butes significantly to its control

Get rid of diseases like this

Calligraphy (anthracnose) - Outbreak of this disease occurs on new leaves, twigs, flowers and fruits. Initially, small brown spots are formed and later on they form large, large round brown spots.The fruits become round, brown spots at the time of storage which later turn dark brown.

So you can control this - Maneab is sprayed by dissolving in 2 grams of water.Mixing 3 grams of blightox in water and spraying can also help to control the disease.Disease can also be prevented by submerging fruits in benlet or carbandazim solution.


Banchitap (Mango malformation) - In this disease Manjari transforms into a bunch which is more hard and green and contains only male flowers.  Because of which it does not bear fruit.  For control, harvesting of bunches in the first week of October, Planophyx 200 ppm.Sprinkle with


Colcy (sooty mold) - This disease is being spread due to the sticky sweet substance extracted by insects.The crust of black mold becomes like this sticky material.This black mold also covers the twigs, due to which the activity of photosynthesis stops and the growth of plants stops.

Control- Effectively prevent the disease by spraying Vetasul (0.2 percent), Matasid (0.1 percent), Gum.accia (0.3 percent).  Spraying of dimethioate or Methyl Demeton insecticide at 1.5 ml per liter of water to control roost, hoppers and other pests.To remove the black crust, spray 2 grams of soluble starch per liter of water and spray it on the leaves.

Take care of its storage and storage

According to the common variety, they ripen in 85105 days.If the fruit is light yellow when cutting the fruit, consider the fruit ripe.Harvest the ripe mango fruits in the morning in such a way so that the fruits do not get bruised and scratched, due to mildew infestation on the injured fruits, rot occurs.Due to economic loss, keep fruits in shady places after harvesting.If there is refrigeration facility, then refrigerate these fruits, which increases the storage capacity of fruits.If this facility is not available, wash the fruits in cold water and dry them in a ventilated and shady place.Classify mango fruits on the basis of size, weight, color and maturity of fruits.It is very important to pack fruits for safe storage, transport and marketing.In India, most fruits are packed in baskets made of bamboo,

entry.content:
If talking about a profitable cultivation then there are cultivation that give profits in low cost and less time.Today we are talking about a similar cultivation.We are talking about garlic cultivation which gives profits in low cost and short time.Actually there is no more heat season for garlic cultivation and there is no more cold weather.You have been told that medium cold climate is suitable for garlic cultivation.Along with this, the amount of biological substances in which the amount of.

Various varieties of garlic

Type 56.4- This type of garlic has been developed from Punjab Agricultural University.Garlic knees are small and are white.There are 25 to 34 probe in each lump.The farmer gets yield to 150 to 200 quintals per hectare.To the development of this type of garlic has been done by Tamilnad Agriculture University.Tubers are white in this type and farmers get more produce from this variety it.
IC 49381- This type of development has been done by the Indian Agriculture Research Institute.From this variety garlic crops are ready in 160 to 180 days.The farmers get more yield from this variety.

This type of Solan-Garlic has been developed from Himachal Pradesh Agricultural University.The leaves of plants in this type are quite wide and long and the color is deep.There are four probe in each lump and are very thick.Compared to other varieties, it is a variety of yielding.

Agri Founded White (41g) - In this variety of garlic, the crop is ready in 150 to 160 days.From this variety garlic yield is 130 to 140 quintals per hectare.This variety has been recommended by the All India Integrated Vegetable Reform Project for the territories of Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh Maharashtra Karnataka.

Yamuna (-1G) White-

This type of garlic has been recommended by the All India Vegetable Reform Project to grow in entire India.This type is ready for 150 to 160 days from the crop and yield per hectare is 150 to 175 quintals.

Yamuna White 2 (G50) - This type is best found for Madhya Pradesh. In this type 160 to 170 days crop is ready and yields per hectare to 150 to 155 quintals.This type is tolerant towards purple blot and scorched disease.

G82- The bulk tubes are white and large size in this variety.Along with this, the crop is ready in 140 to 150 days. In this type the farmer gets 175 to 200 quintals per hectare

IC 42891- This type of garlic has been developed by the Indian Agricultural Research Institute of New Delhi.This type of farmers produce more and the crop is ready in 160.180 days.

Adopt this way for garlic cultivation

Plain two or three in the field.After this, make the cars and Sixthen drains.Let us tell that for more yield of garlic, one and a half-two quintals of healthy buds are per acre.

Do such a garlic sowing and irrigation

Every farmer wants his farming to give him maximum profits but for this he should also adopt the advanced scheme in many ways.The farmers should use the dubring method for more yield.The distance of queues should be up to 15 centimeters.At the same time, the distance between two plants should be 7.5 centimeters. At the same time, the depth of planting should be kept up to 5 centimeters. While there should be a difference of 10 to 15 days for good development of garlic lumps for irrigation.

Prevention from kits in harvest

Throughs - These insects are small and yellow, which make white smears on the leaves, they suck the juice of insects leaves.

Prevention - For the prevention of Neem's decoction or cow urine mixed with micro-zombies and prepare a mixture well.Drink 250 per pump - in the field of sprinkle.

Save the crop from the diseas

Purple (Perfal Block) Blur - This disease is done by Alterinaria Pori, small pink spots fall on leaves and stems.

Prevention - For the prevention of Neem's decoction or cow urine mixed with micro zombies, preparing mixture well by Minnalan 250 per pump.If you do not have to go to the farm.Onion conduity disease - This disease is caused by a mildew named Eurocatoris Sapuli, which becomes a black body in place of seed, which contains bacteria of this disease. Prevention - For its prevention, the seeds should be treated by carosin or cow urine.

Stamefilium Blight - This is the main disease of the leaves in the humid weather it seems more caused by the disease due to mildew.

Prevention - Prevention of neem decoction or cow urine with micro zombies for its prevention and prepare a mixture.

Excavation - Its crop is ready in 4 4 1/2 months, when the crop is ready, the leaves die from the ground, including the plants. After turning up from the leaves above.Small small bundles are kept in 2-3 days, after drying in the sun, the top part is cut.Without any problem is beneficial, the cultivation of mushrooms does not want to get the maximum benefit in less time.If you are also wandering in search of employment and you have a small place for cultivation, then you can get your own job today, we are going to tell you about a similar cultivation.Which provides maximum advantage with very little cost and very low cost.Yes, we are about to discuss about the cultivation .

They are food, inadequate, therapeutic, poisonous and other mushrooms. Food mushrooms are preferred by the villagers. Scientists collected these wild mushrooms and studied the full of their development in the laboratory and developed their production method.Today, many types of mushrooms are being grown not only in the laboratory, but their commercial cultivation is being strengthened by exporting and importing agricultural economies.Mushroom production is backward in Bharat.Here the mushroom research and production growth rate is satisfactory, today approximately 1.00 lakh tonnes of mushrooms are being produced in India, in which 85 percent of the white button is of mushroom.In the second order, the oyster, paragraph mushroom and milky mushrooms.

So let's know what is the mushroom at all.

Mushroom is not a result of fungal, which is an important food diet of modern era due to nutritious, pathogenic, delicious and special smell. Without a leaves, without the ability to create fruits of flowers, which is used in the form of food, in the form of a tonic, full origin in the form of medicines is valuable.The first line describes the morphology and physical functions of the mushroom and the second line describes the characteristic of nourishing and medicinal properties.Due to weather compatibility and intense forests, adequate natural mushrooms in India. The rural is used by its large progress. There is a special interest towards their mushrooms, therefore there is more demand for the business and paragraph mushroom produced at the business level. It has been concluded with the research work done in the Agricultural College and Research Center that four types of mushrooms can be grown at the business level in this area

Professional type of mushroom
1.iShester Mushroom (Plurotas Species)
2.paragraph mushroom (footu) (Volvariela species)


3.White Dudhia Mushroom (Kellosyibi Indica)

4.White Button Mushroom (Augaries BiaPorus)

These are more likely to produce the production of oyster mushroom because it can be cultivated artificially throughout the year.Para Mushrooms and milky mushrooms are relatively low because it can be grown up to a short period (4 months).After the production of paragraph mushroom, its prompt marketing is also a problem. From the experiments done on the white button mushroom, it is clear that two crops can be easily taken in the Pathari areas of Bastar in the cold appearance.In this way artificially growing various mushrooms can be extended throughout the year and the demand of consumers can be fulfilled.

Operated farming

Easeer mushroom can be easily grown in the closed rooms of homes. It requires a low place for its production technique simple and cost is very low, through which every class of society can grow in a small form.It can easily grow from July to March and at many places where the temperature can be grown throughout the year.The production capacity of this mushroom is the highest compared to the second mushroom.

Eyester mushroom is the second largest mushroom in the world.It is also in the second place in India.The advent of the iShester mushroom can be divided into 6 languages.

1. Preparation of Biz (Span)

The seed of mushroom is prepared in a scientific way. These seeds fill 250 or 500 grams / bottle or pouch in bottles or polythical bags.On the mouth of the pouch, the first iron ranges, then they put Rui.There are 2 hours at 22 pound pressure @ square inches in autoclavandhkukur to lives in a bottle or sac.On the cold, the mushroom seed (span) is mixed.This work is done in the bacterial room.The increase of mushroom founders happen in 15-20 days on these grains and the full grains are covered by the poet of Fund.It is called Mushroom Seed (Mother Span).Thus, the seeds are mixed in the second bottle from the bottles, then it is called first child.

2.Pluroes Florida (Indira Shweta)

It can cultivate in Chhattisgarh from July to April.The appropriate temperature to grow it is from 22-280. And moisture should be up to 75.85 percent. This type is a very white color, due to which many people prefer. For its production, light light (250-300 lux) and the proper exchange of air should be appropriate.This variety has been developed by collecting the common pieces in the Narayanpur region of Chhattisgarh.This kind of production has been found good in paracete, wheat, straw, soybean straw.This variety has been developed by Indira Gandhi Agricultural University, Raipur's Mushroom Research Laboratory and has been recommended for production in three agricultural climate areas in Chhattisgarh.

3.Plurotas Sagar.Kaju

It can be easily done in the Chhattisgarh region till July to April. Suitable temperature for this species is 20-22 degrees.And moisture should be up to 80-90 percent. The production capacity is 48.50 percent.During the experiments in Raipur and other parts of the country, the yield of this type is more than other languages.

4. Selection and preparation

Eyester mushrooms can be successfully grown in many types of agricultural residues or mediums which are easily available in the eastern, western and central parts of the country.The eastern part of the country, which is the Chhattisgarh region, the straw of paddy is found abundant. In the western parts of Madhya Pradesh, Soybean straws are easily available in wheat straw and central parts.By experiments, the above agricultural residual oyster mushrooms have been proven to cultivate the above.Eyesth (Plurotas species) can be cultivated in cellulos, Hemisalulos and Ligninayal medium. Its production and biological capacity, used medium, depends on its variety, environment etc.Production of Indira Gandhi Agricultural University, Raipur's Mushroom Research Laboratory
After selecting the appropriate medium, it is very necessary to sterilize it, so that the mushrooms can effectively spread in the said medium and other microors will be deactivated. In the presence of other microorganisms, the mushrooms do not spread properly in the medium, sometimes damage to 100 percent. The university's mushroom research is clear from the experiment in the laboratory that if the medium is treated by steam, by hot water or chemistry, the production capacity is more (103.80-121.20 percent).

5.By hot water-

In this method, 10 kg paragraphs are kept 14-16 hours in 100 liters of water (1-2 inch pieces), which becomes soft, through which the medium becomes soft. After the water, and 2 buckets put hot water in the wet medium.After a hour, the water removes.Spread the medium into a layer at a shady clean place, which will remove additional moisture in the medium.When the medium does not get water from pressing in a hand and the palm is not wet, i.e. 68-72 percent of the medium, then it is suitable to add the mushroom seed.

By chemical law-

In this method, 125 min in 100 liters of water.Mixing Farmelin and 7.5 grams of Bawistin Mixed, therefore, 10 kg medium (Straw) dipped to get 14-16 hours in the solution well. Now let's get a solution through this wet and put it on the pucca floor so that the solution is good. Keep in mind that the straws should be so dry that water did not come to suppress.The weight of this wet straw should be three percent more than the dry straw.

Selecting the suitable medium (wheat straw or paragraph kutty) for the production of oyster mushrooms. Mushroom seeds (span) are mixed by various methods. A good variety of good, fresh, complete grains to be seen in healthy seeds, should be more production capacity.Fresh seeds always produce more. Seed mixture is done at 3 percent or 30 grams seed rate of wet medium per kg.To remove the seed from the bottle, the bottle should be shaken well.If the requirement can be used to piece of spoon or wire.The seed is mixed in a clean location or polythene sheet in a bacterial parakatti.After mixing, fill the mouth from the top of the above shaped bags. The size of the bags size has an impact on the production which is V.V. The mushroom research is clear from the experiment in the laboratory. Production is high in medium-sized bags (18 * 12) and large size (20 * 16) and small size (12 * 8) have been found to be less than comparative vision in comparative points.A quarter part of the pouch remained empty.Tie the mouth of the pouch and tease it all around in the bag so that the air can enter the air inside the bag.The cottage arrangement is prepared in the cottage for the cultivation of mushrooms, and the bags are hanged through them.Cottage can be made of soil, grass-pallet or leaves.It should not be inside the sunlight, but the air should be adequate exchanges. Moisture in the cottage is extremely necessary.It should be mi

This is how care and harvesting should be done

The mushroom head (pin head) starts appearing after 5.6 days after cutting the bags in favorable condition, which increases in size from 5-10 cm to 3-4 days later.Becomes of  When the mushrooms become of the appropriate size, then it is necessary to chop them.In this case they start to turn upwards from the edges.While doing the plowing, be careful not to damage the small growing mushrooms.Thus can be done 3-4 times with a bag.This entire process takes about 2 months.Which signifies that the time has come to remove the para.Do not throw away the used para as it can be used as manure.The mushroom should be used within 810 hours after harvesting, otherwise it can be stored in a polythene bag or bamboo basket and kept in the refrigerator for 6-7 days.Many conservation methods can be used when mushrooms are overproduced.

Mushroom Crop Management

When producing oyster mushrooms, 30% seed / kg of wet medium is added in the appropriate moisture state (6870 per cent) in the inoculated medium.  The mixing is done on a clean paved floor or on a sheet of clean polythene.The mixture is pressed and filled in polythene bags of medium size (18 * 12).Only three quarters of the bag is filled and the remaining one fourth is kept empty.  Tie the mouth of the bag well with a rope and make 4-5 holes in both the bottom corners in the bags so that excess water is removed from these holes and 5-6 holes are placed in the bag for air to move.These seeds (spans) hang mixed bags in wooden huts or rakes in a hut or through nylon rope to hang 4-5 bags on top of each other.
The hut may be made of earthen grass or leaves, bamboo mats etc.Direct sunlight should not come in the hut and the temperature is 25-28 degrees Celsius.Humidity should be 75-85 percent and proper arrangement of air purified.When the humidity is low and the temperature is high, spraying of water should be done on the ground and the walls of the hut from the inside.After 15-20 days of hanging the bags in the hut, the fungus of mushroom mold spreads throughout the medium, causing the medium to appear white milky color.At this time, the polythene bags are cut and separated.This is called the vegetative growth stage of mushrooms.
After the removal of the polythene bag, the nodular structure is obtained and hangs it with a string of twine or nylon.  This is the reproductive stage of mushrooms.Proper care of the bags is very important at this stage.The spacing between two nodular structures should be 10-12 inches.  3-4 days after the removal of the sac, a white gingival structure is seen, which is called mold button or pinhead stage.  After 5-7 days this structure changes into a panegyric with a honeycomb shape.When the edges of the function begin to turn inwards, then they rotate lightly and break it.This mushroom is the edible part of the mold.

In this way, the first one is obtained in 22-25 days respectively.The second and third crops are obtained by a difference of 5 to 7 days respectively.  In this way, one crop takes 45-50 days and 4-5 crops can be taken from July to March.After growing the oyster mushroom in the medium, it can be used again as a spawn but its yield is relatively low.Keep in mind that mushroom produced medium is not very good for yield, but in the absence of availability of spawn, growers use it.

entry.title: If you are able to eliminate carrot
entry.content:
grass around your farm and home, do not panic, then do not panic.Using this grass you can make manure.Not only that if you manure the carrot grass in your farm, you will not need to put another manure.At the same time, agricultural scientists are also beneficial for crops to carrot grass. The unhealthy carrot grass, which is the edge of the railway line and the edge of the fields.Apart from carrot grass crops, there is a serious problem for humans and animals.Diseases like Egjima, Allergies, Fever, Asthma and Najala are coming from this weed contact. By eating it, there are many diseases in animals. If the cow or buffalo eat it, then swelling in their stones and there is a danger of dying of animals.A long time, while living in the Congress power, the carrot grass seeds who came from Mexico have become trouble till today for the farmers.This is a great deal of crops. Many ways come from time to time to eliminate this grass but all have not been proved so effective.Given this, agricultural scientists have said the best to make use of this grass. Dr. Sandeep Kannozia, Dr. Sandeep Kannozia, who is a farming scientist, For this, the Agricultural Science Center is also making aware of the farmers and they are also being told to manure.So that this old problem of farmers go out. "



How can be made

According to Agriculture Scientist, farmers have to dig a crater to composting carrots.The length of the pit should be 12 feet, width four feet and hovering should be five feet. In this pit, there will be a wide wall of nine inches.Will add it straightforward. When three steps will be made for a seven inches after keeping three bricks. Similarly, brick will continue to be direct and lattice.After this dry carrot will keep the grass separate and keep the green carrot separate.

Up to six inches of green and dry stalks will fill the bottom.After this, 5 kg of cow dung will be dissolved in water and put in it.You will also add 2 inches of soil.After filling, a soft wavy stalk will be placed over it.Then mixed with five kilograms of dung water and saturate it.  Similarly, the pit has to be filled up to the top.

Another way to make manure

There are two ways to make manure from carrot grass.The second way is that you have to dig four pits.  Everyone should be one and a half feet apart.Like the earlier method of composting, grass and dung should be stuffed in the pit first.When the material rotates well, the material should be removed from the first pit and put in the second.Then the second material should be taken out and put in the third and the fourth in the same manner.This process will run in the first, second, third and fourth pits and then the compost will be ready.Dr. Sandeep Kannojia, scientist at the Center for Agricultural Sciences, says, "20 tons of manure made from carrot grass is suitable for a hectare field.

2. Cultivation of aloe vera means profitable deal

All of you will know about Aloe Vera.  Yes, almost all people are familiar with its medicinal properties.Aloe vera is such a medicinal medicine with the help of which you can know how many remedies, so today we are going to tell our farmer brothers that cultivation of aloe vera can also give you many benefits and it will be beneficial for you.Will also deal.Guarpatha, Ghritkumari or Aloe vera whose botanical name is Aloe vera barbundis and is a member of the Liliaceae family.Its origin is believed to be North Africa.Aloe vera is called by different names in different languages.It is called Guarpatha in Hindi, Ghritkumari, Gheekunwar, Kumari in Sanskrit, Alloy in English.Aloe vera has many medicinal properties, which are used in the treatment of various diseases in Ayurvedic and Unani systems like stomach worms, stomach ache, vata disorders, skin diseases, burns, eye diseases, facial brighteners.It is useful as a skin cream, shampoo and cosmetics and as a general tonic tonic.  Due to its medicinal properties, it is planted in gardens and around the house.Earlier this plant was not produced commercially and it grows on the banks of the river on its own.  But now, due to its increasing demand, farmers are adopting its cultivation commercially, and are getting proper benefits.

If we talk about aloe vera, then the normal height of its plant is 60.90 cm.  it occurs.The length of its leaves is 30.45 cm.And width 2.5 to 7.5 cm.  And thickness 1.25 cm.Occurs approximately.In Aloe vera, the stem is formed at the top of the root, the leaves grow out of it and initially the leaves are white.The leaves of aloe vera are pointed and cut at the edges.  Red flowers are planted on the center of the plant on a pen.Different species of aloe vera are found in many places in our country.Which is used for the treatment of many types of diseases.  To get more production from its cultivation, farmer brothers keep in mind the following things-
Important information for Aloe vera cultivation- Aloe vera can be grown successfully in areas with hot and temperate climates.It can also be cultivated in areas with low rainfall and high temperatures.It can be cultivated in any type of land.It can also be grown in rocky, rocky, sandy land but not in submerged soil.Baluy loam land whose Ph.D.Values are between 6.5 to 8.0 and proper drainage system is appropriate.

How to do this preparation for the cultivation of aloe vera- In summer, the field should be prepared by preparing the drainage drains well and during the rainy season, the plants should be 50 - 50 cm in suitable humidity conditions.  Rams are planted in the field.40 cm distance between plants in less fertile soil.Can keep  Due to this, the number of plants per hectare requires about 40,000 to 50,000.It is planted in June-July.But in irrigated condition it can be planted in February.

In aloe vera this is done in the way of nindai-gudhi-its growth rate is slow in the initial stage.Hence 2-3 nudai pudding is required in the first three months.Because in this period, various weeds grow rapidly and adversely affect the growth and development of aloe vera.After 8 months, soil the plant so that they do not fall.

Use of fertilizers and fertilizers in this way - Aloe vera crops generally do not require special fertilizers or fertilizers.  But for good growth and yield, 10-15 tonnes of good rotten dung manure should be added to the field at the time of final plowing.Apart from this, 50 kg.  Natrajan, 25 kg.Phosphorus and 25 kg.  Potash element should be given.Out of which half the amount of nitrogen and phosphorus and potash should be given in two parts at the time of full transplantation and the remaining amount of nitrogen after 2 months or the remaining amount of nitrogen can be sprayed twice.

How to irrigate in aloe vera crop - aloe vera can be grown in unirrigated condition.  But in the irrigated stage the yield increases significantly.  In summer, it is appropriate to irrigate at intervals of 20-25 days.You can use sprinkler or drip method to save irrigation water and use it more.

Keep the plants safe like this - there is usually no outbreak of insects or diseases in this crop.But grubs damage underground stems and roots.  For prevention, give 60-70 kg neem cake per hectare or 20-25 kg.  Chlorpyriphos dust per hectare.Rains and spots are found on the stems and leaves during the rainy season, which is a fungal disease.For this treatment, spraying with Mencozeb 3 grams per liter of water is appropriate.

Keep in mind that its harvesting and yield are very high - the production capacity of this crop is very high. After planting the crop, the leaves become cut after one year.After this, ripe leaves should be cut from the interval of two months.The irrigated area produces 35-40 tonnes per hectare in the first year.And in the second year, production increases by 10-15 percent.  It can be harvested for three consecutive years on the basis of proper care and proper nutrient management.About 20 tons per hectare production is found in the irrigated stage.

So this is how its transplanting and amplification method - its propagation is done through botanical method.  Small plants with four to five leaves emerging from adult plants are suitable, initially these plants are white in color and become green when grown.These stolandsharkus are separated from the mother plant and planted in the nursery or directly in the field.
